title: Loving my new journey
paragraph: I know that this journey is different for everyone and I‚Äôve made other changes in my diet (no alcohol since last year and minimal refined sugars) and exercise routine, but when I began my journey 8 weeks ago I was 144lbs. I‚Äôm back to my college athlete weight 122lbs and feeling really good and healthy. My energy levels are way up. My joints are not popping and crackling as much and I‚Äôd say my overall mood is much better. It seems like everything would upset me prior to starting Winona. I feel more level headed and even keeled now. üíú

title: Winona!! Thank you
paragraph: Saw Winona on Facebook and was willing to try anything after years of debilitating hip and back pain. I tried everything else and was even considering stem cells when I came across Winona.  I filled out the form and was contacted within a day. The doctor asked me a few more questions and then prescribed estrogen and DHEA. I had my products the next week and I swear within 3 weeks my hip and back pain were gone. I didn't want to tell anyone with fear it may come back at any time. It's been 3 week and still gone. Dr Peter checked back in with me at 10 weeks asking how everything was going and said he would check back at 1 year again but to please reach out if any concerns or changes. Love this product and that someone was willing to listen to my concerns and not dismiss that they couldn't find anything wrong. It changed my quality of life. Thank you

I‚Äôm still unsure about HRT but as soon as one year has passed without a period I will taper off hormones. I‚Äôm so grateful I tried it. I feel like I got a second chance at happiness.

A popular article is one that debunks the common misconceptions and myths around menopause and HRT. You can read that article here: https://bywinona.com/journal/truths-and-myths-about-menopause/‚ÄãÔªøÔªøAs far as HRT causing cancer, studies have shown that women receiving bioidentical hormone replacement therapy (HRT) do not have any apparent increased risks for cancer, clots, or strokes. The article I linked above explores this further.‚ÄãÔªøÔªøIt's also worth mentioning that our hormones are not sourced from animals but instead, are derived from plants.A confirmed personal history of cancer is a contraindication to HRT, but a family history is not. We ask women about their health history during their onboarding process, and we do not accept anyone who is not an appropriate candidate. For women who do have a family history of cancer and are concerned about their risks, our doctors may recommend genetic testing.We would love to elaborate on our process with you, but we cannot locate an account under your name as it is listed here. title: It works!
paragraph: I‚Äôve had hot flashes on and off since I turned 40, and night sweats have flared up here and there I thought I was controlling using herbs. but this year, at 46, the night sweats became unstoppable. They rolled in every 2 hours and lasted 20 minutes. I was losing sleep and becoming very upset. My doc told me she couldn‚Äôt recommend HRT because I‚Äôm too young and they only want to put me on it for a max of 5 years because of the risk of breast cancer. I deep dive into this told me this information is incorrect. Desperate for rest, I signed up with  Winona and one other company to compare. Winona recommended a compounded cream that has estrogen & progesterone. The other company recommended an estrogen patch and a progesterone pill. Since apparently the pill has a few side effects (bloating, tiredness, breast tenderness) and the cream does not, I went with Winona and the cream. It took longer than I expected to take effect. The hot flashes started lessening after 3 weeks, and it took 7 to eliminate them entirely, but now they‚Äôre gone and I am so flipping relieved.

I‚Äôm so glad you took the time to research and advocate for yourself when the information you received didn‚Äôt feel right. It‚Äôs wonderful to hear that you chose Winona and that the compounded cream has finally brought you the relief you desperately needed, even if it took a bit longer than expected. You deserve to feel like yourself again, and I‚Äôm so relieved that you‚Äôre now able to rest peacefully. Thank you for putting your trust in us‚Äîwe‚Äôre here for you every step of the way.

title: Not for me
paragraph: I was prescribed a 90 day supply of estrogen cream w. progesterone 3/150mg/ml and DHEA 25mg. The 3-month supply for both was about $250. I took it as prescribed for 90 days and if anything, my menopause symptoms increased, with more weight gain and more fatigue. When I told the prescribing doctor that my symptoms were unchanged, they just offered to increase the dosage. At this point I need to just suck it up and visit an in-person menopause practicioner and try something else.I feel like I got suckered in by all the overwhelmingly positive reviews. I'm disappointed that it didn't work and I gained 10 lbs and am out $250. Not saying mail order bioidentical estrogen doesn't work...but this didn't work for me. This review will probably never see the light of day, as I'm sure Winona scrubs negative reviews.
reply_paragraph: Thank you for your feedback, Mimi!We do not "scrub" any negative reviews, and always want our patients to be honest and open about their experiences with us as it helps us to improve our services.We are saddened to hear that your body did not adjust to your treatment plan as you had hoped. Bioidentical HRT helps most women, but as with all medical interventions, there are no guarantees. Most women see improvement after a few weeks, and we can say that 80% of patients are satisfied with how they feel around the three-month mark.‚ÄãIf your symptoms have not improved after 10-weeks, we can change the dose or the medication to try to help you feel better.It can take time for your body to acclimate to the influx of hormones. These are real prescription medications, prescribed by real doctors, just like you would receive in a doctor's office. The only difference between Winona and your personal doctor is that we conduct our visits via telehealth. Be assured that your Winona doctor is available if problems arise or if you have any questions about treatment. We are committed to helping you find the appropriate medication and dose that benefits you the most.A member of our Patient Care team has emailed you for further support!

title: About 3 months ago
paragraph: About 3 months ago, I started the 50/50 cream and DHEA after many sleepless nights, severe brain fog and night sweats. Weight gain also was a major factor for going on Winona. After 3 months, I still have some issues with sleeping all the way through the night and no change in my weight, unfortunately. I‚Äôm a healthy and balanced eater so this was a disappointment after reading so many success stories. When I wrote the doctor, she recommended doubling my cream and DHEA intake. I obliged and experienced nausea, irritability and not being able to sleep for over a week. I immediately went back to my original dosage amount and felt relief. Not very impressed with my doctors communication as they prescribe almost as a side hustle. I also find their recent marketing tactics that are now everywhere in my social media feeds to be incredibly condescending, and not informative. I‚Äôm a professional woman who wants reputable information without the sarcasm. I appreciate humor but not when you are desperate for relief. I was also eager to be part of Winona‚Äôs online community where I could ask questions on nutrition, other women‚Äôs experiences but none of my posts were accepted for posting. So you have to sift through hundreds of posts to find information that may not even be relevant to your question while still following their community guidelines. I will be consulting with my regular OBGYN who is difficult to book on other alternatives. Ill stay on until then as Winona helped with the night sweats and brain fog. I do appreciate the no wait to start their prescriptions. I wish their was more relief and more professionalism with their community and platform.
reply_paragraph: Thank you for sharing your experience with us, Betsy.We understand your frustration with the lack of progress in your sleep and weight management goals despite starting HRT, and we are sorry!We know it's disheartening, despite following your Winona doctor's guidance. Every woman is different, and, unfortunately, it can take longer for some to find the correct dose and combination of medication for relief.We also acknowledge your concerns about the doctor's communication and the recent marketing tactics. We strive to provide clear and informative communication, and we appreciate your feedback on this aspect. We value your input about our online community and understand the importance of a supportive and informative platform for women during this phase of their lives.  The menopause transition can feel so dark and lonely, and we only wish to lighten the gravity of it with humor sometimes!We're committed to continually improving our online community to ensure it provides a valuable resource for our users. We're glad to hear that our products have provided relief from night sweats and brain fog, but we understand that you would like more relief in other areas.Unfortunately, we cannot locate you as a patient using your name as it is listed here.  We would love to assist you further, though, as we want all of our patients to be happy!Please reach out to our Patient Services Department at hello@bywinona.com.We look forward to hearing from you!

title: A.M.A.Z.I.N.G The dread is gone!
paragraph: A.M.A.Z.I.N.G - I felt it was a cruel joke that women lost a lot after menopause. Men don‚Äôt loose anything. This causes a lot of discord in relationships. Well after Winona that has changed. Everything is better. First and foremost I have suffered with arthritis and joint pain for years. Now I go days without even thinking about the pain. I have more energy. But most of all ‚Äúthe lady parts‚Äù have WOKEN up!! I wish I had found this years ago. Now I feel like I have so much time to make up for. The drudgery is gone! It‚Äôs fun again. No more dread. If anything I get irritated because it doesn‚Äôt happen more. I can‚Äôt say enough about this treatment. My husband has taken DHEA for years, which I feel has helped him stay young. He doesn‚Äôt look or act his age. I use to hate to see him take it because I knew it increased his drive. It was the easiest process to start. The doctors are quick to answer and very helpful and encouraging. I tell my friends about this but I wish I could shout it from the rooftops. I started treatment 5/24.Thanks Winona

paragraph: A Game-Changer for My Hormonal Health (Bi-est Estrogen/Progesterone Cream)I‚Äôve been navigating the ups and downs of hormonal changes for a while now, and I‚Äôm thrilled to share how By Winona‚Äôs Bi-est Cream has truly transformed my experience. It‚Äôs remarkable how a good night‚Äôs sleep can affect your overall well-being.Goodbye to Aches and Pains - My legs used to ache constantly, which was not only uncomfortable but also impacted my daily activities. Thanks to the Bi-est Cream, those aches have become a thing of the past. The relief has been profound, and I‚Äôm enjoying a level of comfort that I hadn‚Äôt experienced in a long time.Revitalized Skin - Another unexpected benefit has been the improvement in my skin‚Äôs texture. It‚Äôs now noticeably more supple and hydrated. The cream has helped restore a youthful glow, making me feel more confident and refreshed.By Winona‚Äôs Bi-est Cream has exceeded my expectations in every way. Its effectiveness in alleviating symptoms has made a real difference in my quality of life. The convenience of application and the noticeable results have made this product an essential part of my daily nightly routine.For anyone considering HRT or struggling with similar symptoms, I wholeheartedly recommend giving By Winona‚Äôs Bi-est Cream a try. It‚Äôs been a game-changer for me, and I believe it could be just as transformative for others seeking relief and balance.

title: I can‚Äôt thank Winona enough‚Ä¶
paragraph: I can‚Äôt thank Winona enough. Initially, I was skeptical that anything would work for my despair in menopause, but I figured, ‚Äúwhat do I have to lose?‚Äú  However, much to my surprise, I began to immediately feel diminishing hot flashes, brain fog, and tearful emotions.  As the weeks went on, I began to notice my body changing. This was the most surprising effect out of all of my positive results‚Äîthis is not to say I am at my personal best in terms of weight, but I do see a thinning throughout my legs, midsection and arms. I‚Äôm also quite possibly noticing my face changing. So, if you‚Äôre at all pensive about trying this hormone replacement, please do yourself a favor and give it a go. What do you have to lose except feeling hopeless and helpless for the rest of your life?
reply_paragraph: We appreciate your honest and detailed review, Deborah!We understand that the menopause transition can be a challenging time for many women and that there is a lot of confusing and contradictory information out there.  We're glad you decided to give Winona a try and that you're seeing improvements in your overall well-being now!Your experience is a testament to the potential benefits of hormone replacement therapy, and we hope more women who are skeptical will give it a try too!Thank you for your trust in us!

title: When I realized my sudden weight gain‚Ä¶
paragraph: When I realized my sudden weight gain mood changes, etc. we‚Äôre not because of diet or health but because of hormones I immediately turned to Winona and I‚Äôm so glad I started I am going on my fourth month here soon and I have been starting to see the hormonal weight fall off. My mood swings become less crazy and my hair starting to grow back.
reply_paragraph: Congratulations on your success, Tracey!The menopause transition can bring about rapid,  stubborn, and frustrating weight gain that does not respond to any of our previous control measures.  This hormonal weight gain will also be distributed differently, and may leave us feeling more round in places that we don't want to be round!Once hormone levels are optimal with the right treatment plan, and the metabolic effects of declining hormone levels are reversed, weight loss can then be possible.Better, more stable moods, and improved quality of our hair and skin are also welcome benefits of HRT!We appreciate the 5 stars!

title: Not One Size Fits All
paragraph: In theory this program seems great but there are many limitations to receiving internet-based care. I did like the use of bioidentical hormones and the compounded estrogen/progesterone cream. I hate taking pills if I don't have to. They were shipped before you ran out and you were able to customize with either one additional pump or one less pump of cream based on how you were responding. The doctor was nice as long as you didn't ask too many questions. These are doctors who have full-time jobs already and this is generally a side gig for them for more income I'm sure, so don't expect more personalized care.That being said, you fill out an initial questionnaire and it seems they have a standard formula they like to start people on. This also includes the use of DHEA. Despite the fact that my testosterone levels and DHEA levels were significantly too high the doctor insisted it was beneficial to use, for what reason I'm not sure. I ultimately had to stop taking it because of the side effects which wasted 2.5 months worth of medication. You do have the option to refill your medications monthly but they encourage the 3-month prescription since changes will not be made anyway until after your 10-week review (it's just another questionnaire you fill out, not an actual visit with your doctor). Refilling monthly ends up being more expensive but if you have any doubts it may be worth doing that for your first 3 months just to make sure this is for you. Treatment is not based on lab work which is fine to a point, however if anything presents itself that can make it more difficult to figure out appropriate treatment they are either not prepared to work through that, don't have the time or don't care to. Heaven forbid you bring up concerns or questions about increased blood pressure, increased weight gain, ongoing unresolved symptoms or new symptoms- they just end your treatment. It's definitely an investment and for 3 months of basic treatment will run you upwards of $300. You can choose to do estrogen and progesterone pills or cream, they want you to take DHEA pills since they are unable to prescribe testosterone, they offer a female Viagra so to speak and I think a few other miscellaneous things. So for those who are fortunate enough to only need a little dose of hormones to make you right again, this program will be fine. For those who tend to have a more difficult menopause it's probably best to try and find an actual in-person physician who is willing to make the effort to try and resolve your symptoms. Hormones do have side effects and for some people pose a greater risk when taking them, despite what every single doctor may say about the ones they prescribe. Don't let them gaslight you into thinking otherwise. Just do your homework because this program is not for everybody. Lesson learned. *By Winona, if you respond, you will not find my specific information in your system because this is my new email address. Either way, I don't need a response and I just outlined the general information for your program as well as my experience with it. Definitely not the worst that's on this review platform. Thank you.
reply_paragraph: We appreciate your feedback, Emily, as we do strive every day to provide our patients with treatment and service worthy of 5 stars.   We take all comments seriously, good or bad, and do try to maintain a professional and trustworthy plan of care for you.Unfortunately, as you indicated,  we cannot locate an account under your name as it is listed here.  You did not provide any email address.You are correct that HRT is not prescribed based on lab work.It is prescribed based on symptoms, in accordance with the AMA, NAMS, and the American College of Obstetrics and Gynecologists.Our Winona doctors review the health history and onboarding information that you provide and prescribe a treatment plan that they feel would benefit you the most. All of our doctors are board-certified, well established, and specialize in the care of women going through the menopause transition, something that is lacking for women in today's world. We take your health and safety very seriously and will not accept anyone who is not a candidate for HRT. Our primary focus is not based on monetary goals, but rather a goal of providing women safe and effective HRT who may not otherwise have access to it. The decision to receive a 1 month supply or a 3 month supply of medication is totally up to the patient.  We have no preference for the amount that can be prescribed to you, as we are acutely aware that cost is a factor for many women.  The 3 month supply is cheaper in the long run, but we have many women who opt to only receive a monthly prescription. Our treatments help most women, but as with all medical interventions, there are no guarantees.  This applies to online providers as well as brick and mortar providers. Fortunately, the majority of women do not experience any side effects at all.  For those that do, they usually only occur in the initial few weeks of treatment as the body is adjusting to the increased hormone levels. Bloating, breast tenderness, nausea, etc. are usually short lived and manageable. Most women see improvement after a few weeks, and we can say that 80% of patients are satisfied with how they feel around the three-month mark.  It can be hard to acclimate to an online platform for your health care needs, and our Winona doctors understand this.   They always provide you ongoing support and guidance to ensure you have the best treatment plan for your symptoms. ‚ÄãIf your symptoms have not improved after 10-weeks, we can change the dose or the medication to try to help you feel better. However, it can take time for your body to acclimate to the influx of hormones. These are real prescription medications, prescribed by real doctors, just like you would receive in a doctor's office. Again, be assured that your Winona doctor is available if problems arise or if you have any questions about treatment.We are committed to helping you find the appropriate medication and dose that benefits you the most and would love the opportunity to resolve any issues that you may have encountered. Please contact our Patient Care Team at hello@bywinona.com.We look forward to hearing from  you!

title: I no longer feel like I am going to die.
paragraph: It's so embarrassing and an indictment on the medical community that Facebook's algorithm diagnosed my perimenopause symptoms. I had no idea that join pain, bloating and anxiety were manifestations of perimenopause!I do have a hysterectomy so I feel like the risk of perimenopause could have been detected if even one doctor had looked at my chart in context just once in the last 5 years. I've been told the severe joint pain was all in my head. I was told having one ovary meant HRT wasn't necessary.For the last year I've felt exhausted, bloated and unable to focus on anything. Constant anxiety. I thought I was literally dying and nothing I could say would convince any doctor that I had a real problem. I've gained a ton of weight that was impossible to lose. By the time I saw the Winona facebook ad I had little faith that anything would help. I was pretty convinced I was dying from some undiagnosed medical condition. I gave up going to the doctor because they offered no help and treated me like I was stupid.I was wrong and pleasantly surprised. After taking my first dose I slept through the entire night and woke up with significantly less joint pain! After a couple weeks, the bloating and gastro problems I've been experiencing for YEARS have completely cleared up. I've only lost a couple pounds, but I feel like a real person again!The Winona process was simple and everything went the way it should. I'm so grateful they exist because I'd also given up going to the doctor to fight with them about my symptoms. I'm really glad I gave it a chance! Now I am telling everyone because I'm so mad it took a facebook ad to cure me.If you are looking to feel normal again and think this even has a remote possibility of being an issue for you, I really recommend it. The difference for me is night and day and I really can't believe all the problems that HRT has resolved. It's like a mirace!
reply_paragraph: For much of medical history, women's needs and their right to quality health care has been very limited, if non-existent for certain diagnoses. Women are viewed as "complicated" or "complainers" who should be able to deal with their own health issues, especially when it comes to menopause.Winona understands this, Hilary, and we are trying to change the view on menopause and it's treatment!Women should not have to suffer!  And if they are suffering, then they should be able to have their symptoms addressed and resolved!The menopause transition can affect every system in the body - cognitive, muscular, cardiovascular, bones and joints, vision, etc., and it can definitely make you feel like your life is ending.The process is even more harsh and dramatic for those women who have their ovaries removed, as your body immediately has no way to produce adequate levels of hormones that you need. It's disheartening to hear that your symptoms were dismissed for so long and that you felt unheard by medical professionals. However, we are THRILLED that you found relief through Winona and that you're feeling better now!We appreciate you sharing your story and hope it helps others who may be struggling with similar issues to know that we can help them too!

title: I am very pleasantly surprised by the care offered.
paragraph: I am very pleasantly surprised at the attentiveness of the doctor and the ease at which my dosage can be altered to fit my needs. I hope in the near future that medical insurance will cover this medical care. I currently am able to use my FSA and that is very helpful, however, it would be more affordable if my medical insurance would accept and cover this form of medical care.
reply_paragraph: We understand that utilizing an on online platform for health care needs can be a little scary and intimidating at first, Kim.Because we focus solely on the care of women going through the menopause transition though, we are able to make our onboarding process concise, quick, and easy!Using our online platform is similar to an in-person visit, except that you can have your consultation with a board-certified Winona doctor in the comfort of your own home :)We agree that more insurance companies should cover the cost of bioidentical HRT, as menopause is a natural occurrence in a woman's life.  There is no reason that she should suffer through it or have it affect her long-term health. We are deeply grateful for your trust in us, and appreciate your support!

title: I am 59.  I should‚Äôve started Winona 11 years ago.
paragraph: I have been using Winona bi-est  cream and DHEA tablets for 2 weeks now and I am already finding relief from brain fog, exhaustion and constant body aches.  There is hope!  I am 59 and tried every anti-depressant, anti-anxiety out there.  Of course since that is NOT what my body needed, they didn‚Äôt work.  I kept trying different supplements hoping to find the right combination.  Something, anything to feel like myself again. This went on for 11 years.  I felt completely depleted.  I kept waiting for the menopause symptoms to go away.  I am 59 for heavens sake!  My symptoms were not getting better.  The hot flashes and sweats were replaced with constant body aches.  They were getting worse daily.  That is when I found Winona.  I read testimonials of women experiencing exactly the same thing I was.  Who knew that all of these crazy health issues could be chalked up to lack of estrogen?!  I had no idea!Needless to say, I have hope.  I am already feeling so much better than I did 2 weeks ago.  My only regret: I didn‚Äôt discover Winona 11 years ago.
reply_paragraph: Having hope is confidence that tomorrow will be better, Kimberly, and we are confident that you will live your best life now!Unfortunately, we hear similar stories of frustration and desperation from other women daily about how they have tried everything in the book trying to just feel normal again. Menopause symptoms can be debilitating, and women may eventually just give up on themselves and accept the misery as part of aging.It doesn't have to be that way though, and we applaud your ability to persevere and not accept feeling less than your best at this time in your life!We are saddened to think that you lost 11 long years to menopause symptoms, but take comfort in knowing that your review will help other women to know that there is no reason for them to suffer any longer!Thank you so much for the 5 stars!

paragraph: I have been in Winona for 6 months now and I can‚Äôt say enough wonderful things about it . I started out with hot flashes and just not feeling like myself . The first 3 months were up and down for me with night sweats gone but I felt bloated and gassy . I almost got frustrated and quit but kept with it and now I feel like my body is more stable and under control . I wake up less , no more night sweats , and the bloating is completely gone. I have not lost any weight yet so I‚Äôm excited to see how that goes .
reply_paragraph: Whoo hooo, Brandi!The menopause transition is not an easy one, and there can be lots of ups and downs along the way, but we are so glad that you stuck with us!The transition itself can take years, and, sometimes, full relief can also take some time. The most annoying symptoms, such as the hot flashes, joint pain, brain fog, etc., are often the first to resolve.  Other things, like reversing weight gain, will take longer. We are confident that you will feel even better at the one year mark. Thank you so much for your trust in us and for giving us a chance!

title: DHEA is a must have
paragraph: The appointment was quick and easy! And so was getting my prescription.  I reached out to this company because I am going through peri-menopause. I am 50 years old and am on birth control for the first time to control extremely heavy periods. I am not ready to commit to full HRT but the past year I have noticed a drop in libido and dryness like the Sahara Desert! My skin was itchy. Down there became itchy. Sex became uncomfortable as well as just different. And the bottle of lubrication with a pump wasn‚Äôt my favorite piece of decor. I came across By Winona on Instagram and gave it a go. Someone told me about DHEA so that is what I inquired about. I am now at 11 weeks and what a change! I noticed the changes after the first 2 weeks. No longer itchy anywhere and have not used lubrication since starting it. I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs just placebo but I feel 17 again. The mental part of my sex drive still comes and goes but satisfaction and comfort level while it‚Äôs happening is at an all time high. Both myself and my husband could not be happier. Highly recommend this company.
reply_paragraph: We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience about Winona, Faith!Perimenopause symptoms can bring about unexpected and uncomfortable changes in our menstrual cycles, skin, and libido levels. It can be frustrating to deal with them, as well as for our spouses or loved ones who often don't understand how to help. It's encouraging to know that the DHEA has made such a huge difference in your life after only 2 weeks!We also offer bioidentical Estrogen and Progesterone to help with any additional symptoms that may change over time.Thank you for the 5 stars!

title: Winona cream
paragraph: I‚Äôve been on the cream for almost 11 weeks. My symptoms were brain fog, anxiety, moodiness, heart palpitations, varicose leg throbbing pain, hair loss, weight gain, back pain and right hip pain freq nighttime urination, sleeping issues because of the urination issue. for over a year it was getting worse. Most days I didn‚Äôt even like myself. I‚Äôm almost 49 in peri with normal cycles. This has been a game changer for me. All my symptoms are better. Within the first use I slept so sound and don‚Äôt wake up except 1 time a night. My hair loss is better. My weight hasn‚Äôt changed, but in all fairness I am working on better diet and strength training. No back or hip pain upon waking is gone. My mood feels hopeful. Anxiety gone.  Brain fog is gone I thought I was developing dementia. Heart palpitations gone. Everything for me got better with the first use. I did need to lower my dose 1/100mg and that‚Äôs working really well. The process is so easy. Answer questions, doctor looks at your symptoms and prescription comes in the mail. Fast service on questions that I might need answering by my online ob doc too. This has been a game changer for my life. I feel so many women suffer or have suffered through this stage when there is help.
reply_paragraph: Thank you for sharing your experience with your menopause symptoms and your results since starting HRT, Danielle!It sounds like you were suffering intensely, and we are so happy to know that you are feeling more like yourself.We often hear about hot flashes and low libido, but menopause symptoms can affect every system in the body, including the cognitive, cardiac, and urinary systems. Sharing your experience helps other women who may be hesitant about starting HRT to know that it can be a game changer for them too!Thank you for your support!

title: Simple, hassle-free relief
paragraph: I'm 53 and I felt like everything changed in the wrong way. Good sleep was so rare I considered it a myth. Most nights I couldn't fall asleep or stay asleep. My moods were so erratic, and irritation was my default response. I started avoiding everyone and everything because I hated the flash rages I couldn't control. Focus at home or work was impossible. And the weight gain!!! Nothing helped. Diet drugs helped with 10-15 lbs, but I couldn't get the rest to budge. ADHD drugs made my heart race or put my brain in turbo mode but with the attention span of a gnat.. my project list exploded, but nothing got done. Sleeping pills, yoga, meditation.. nothing helped. Until doom scrolling popped up Winona.  From the comfort of my living room, in just a few minutes, I had a doctor!  No waiting an hour passed my appt time in a drab room. She was super responsive to my questions, and my meds arrived quickly. Three months later, I'm sleeping deeper and longer each night. I'm happier, more alert during the day. My focus is incredible, to the point coworkers ask how I get so much done each day. Best of all, my flash fits if irritation and rage are gone. I'm me again. Without side effects. I love being uniquely me again.
reply_paragraph: You deserve to feel like yourself again, Stacey, and Winona is proud to help you do that!The menopause transition can be such an overwhelming and confusing time period is a woman's life.Unpredictable mood swings, insomnia, brain fog, rapid weight gain, etc., are all symptoms that can leave you feeling defeated and depressed.Unfortunately, a lot of women report to us that their personal doctors will prescribe antidepressants or unnecessary medications to try to relieve symptoms.  They don't understand how the menopause transition can affect women, and they don't realize that all of these seemingly unconnected symptoms are related to fluctuating hormones!We are grateful that you stopped scrolling and gave yourself a chance to feel better!

title: Winona wasn‚Äôt right for me
paragraph: Winona wasn‚Äôt right for me. First, the prescription for HRT seemed to be a generic, ‚Äúone size fits all‚Äù type of approach. Without any real review of my personal health history, I was prescribed a progesterone/estrogen cream and DHEA supplement. Shortly afterwards, my face exploded with acne. I have had acne my entire adult life, and it significantly worsened with the initial treatment. I did some independent research and discovered that DHEA elevates testosterone levels. Prior to trying Winona, I had had my hormone levels tested, and my testosterone was already too high and out of normal range. Winona never asked about prior labs or hormone levels, and I never actually spoke to a doctor before my a prescription was given; they just assumed that this supplement should be given. When I asked to discontinue the supplement, it was a bit of a hassle. Instead of listening to my concerns, the rep I spoke to kept trying to sell me on the ‚Äúbenefits‚Äù of HRT. After I told her multiple times that I was having a bad reaction to the medication and did not need to increase my already too high testosterone levels, she told me I needed to speak to one of their doctors to get permission to cancel my subscription to the DHEA. Once resolved, I did continue to use the cream. However, Winona refused to provide information I needed to get reimbursed by my insurance company for the costs. Before selecting an insurance plan, I confirmed that any HRT would be covered, but was never able to use that coverage, because Winona has a policy against working with insurance companies (or, apparently, answering patient questions if the purpose of the questions is related to using insurance). That became my primary reason for deciding to go with an in-network, NAMS certified doctor instead of Winona - because I didn‚Äôt want to keep spending hundreds of dollars out of pocket on medication my insurance would otherwise cover.
reply_paragraph: We are deeply sorry to hear that Winona was not right for you, TG, but, unfortunately, we cannot locate an account under your name as it is listed here.As each woman is unique, her symptoms will also be unique, so we prescribe customized, bioidentical HRT treatment plans. HRT is prescribed based on symptoms, as is recommended by the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists and NAMS, as well as the AMA. Blood hormone levels can vary greatly from day-to-day, so blood tests are not necessarily an accurate indication of what you might need. Bloodwork can appear "perfect" on paper, but you still may have symptoms.Our Winona doctors carefully review your onboarding questionnaire and health history information that you provide before any medications are prescribed to you.  Not all women will qualify for a treatment plan, so if you are prescribed a treatment plan, you can be assured that you are an ideal candidate for HRT. Some women do experience acne when first starting DHEA, as it is converted to Estrogen and Testosterone in the body. It is a safe, more gentler way to get the Testosterone that women need without the pure Testosterone side effects.  However, it is often short lived and resolves as your body adjusts to the influx of hormones. We know it is hard to be patient during this time!We are not able to bill your insurance company for you, but we never refuse to provide receipts that you may submit to your insurance company for possible reimbursement.  The receipts can be downloaded from your Patient Portal at any time, or can be sent to you by contacting our Patient Care team. Our Winona doctors and staff are always willing to assist you in any way possible with whatever you need. We are saddened to see the review of your experience and would like to help resolve the situation. Please contact our Patient Care team at hello@bywinona.com.We look forward to hearing from you!

reply_paragraph: Thank you for your feedback, Justina!We know that in today's world human interaction is becoming a less common thing as AI increases.However, we can assure you that we are real people behind your screen!These are real prescription medications, prescribed by real board certified doctors, and that can't be accomplished by AI.They review each and every woman personally to make sure she is a good candidate for treatment. Our doctors do not speak on the phone, or communicate through zoom calls, to protect your privacy. They continue to maintain hospital hours, and they do not want to breach your confidentiality accidentally by someone listening on their end, or yours. We are glad to hear that your personal doctor is onboard with HRT, but please know that it is not prescribed based on lab work. Blood hormone levels can vary greatly from day-to-day, so blood tests are not necessarily an accurate indication of what you might need. Bloodwork can appear "perfect" on paper, but you still may have symptoms.HRT is, therefore, prescribed based on symptoms and medical history. We want you to feel better, not necessarily "fix" your lab values.We would be sorry to see you go, but are proud to have helped you find relief so far!

title: Winona Saved My Life
paragraph: Winona saved my life. While that might sound dramatic, it's not. After years of suffering with constant joint and muscle pain, weight gain, fatigue, not sleeping, bladder leakage, and a whole myriad of other complaints, it took serious and unexplained dental issues that came on out of nowhere to send me to the internet to figure out just what was going on with me after my periodontist told me "half of my practice is women in their 50's going through the change".  I then went to my general practitioner and my gynecologist for help, who both confirmed I was likely experiencing menopause (I had a hysterectomy 10 years ago but my ovaries were left) but pretty much told me "This is the way things are.  You'll get used to it".  The past 3 years I have been more and more depressed, and these dismissals did not help that.  I found Winona online, and I'm so glad I did.  I figured that given my current mental state, giving it a try wasn't going to hurt.  The ease of the initial questions and having prescriptions on their way to me within a few days honestly made me cry with hope that relief was on its way.  Within 3 days, I was experiencing relief from most of my physical symptoms, but the thing that changed the fastest and most dramatically was my mental state.  I'm not suggesting that hormones will help anyone else's depression, but it certainly helped mine.  It's now been 11 weeks and I am back to who I used to be.  I'm so happy that this site makes treatment available to women who need it, and it scares me to think of just how low my mood was and how much worse it may have gotten. My doctor is fantastic with quick responses and lots of detailed information.  I couldn't be happier that I found this site.  Thank you, Winona!
reply_paragraph: We are deeply humbled to receive your review, Karen!It is truly rewarding to know that we were able to help you find relief from your symptoms and improve your overall well-being.Sadly, we hear similar stories from other women who are experiencing debilitating symptoms, but often don't associate them with menopause.  We understand that navigating menopause can be challenging, and we are committed to providing women with the resources and support they need to feel their best!Thank you for the 5 stars!

I was hoping it would help my weight and hair thinning but has not at least not yet. Was going to give it the 3 mo mark.  I spoke with the dr just last week for my 10 wk follow up and he suggested increasing my dosage on two of my meds. So I am hoping this will help as well. It definitely has already helped tremendously and hoping for even better results. I am on the estradiol tablet, DHEA capsule and progesterone capsule.

paragraph: Where do I start? I was lost when it came to understanding what was really going on with my body. Things were changing, but I wasn‚Äôt sure it was menopause. I was having issues with my anger‚Ä¶something that was very unlike me in the past and was the main reason I came to Winona to begin with. It was affecting my daily mood & was afraid of it lashing out at my friends, family, and child. Since starting Winona, I haven‚Äôt had one of these rage episodes. My sleep has become more regular & less dependent on sleep aids. My skin has become noticeably less dry‚Ä¶. I am super happy about my decision to try Winona & continue my journey with them. They are very responsive to my questions & concerns regarding my health.

title: You won't be disappointed!
paragraph: I was feeling so bad. Achy joints,especially my hips, moody and tired. I had gained 50lbs in less than a year. My family thought that I was crazy!! I had a hysterectomy in 2020, but they left my ovaries. I knew menopause would be coming but I didn't know it would bring all of that! NO ONE TELLS YOU THIS!! I had hot flashes and night sweats, I expected those. But the sleepless nights? NO! I saw Drew Barrymore talking about Winona and I was curious. Then I saw an add on Facebook and thought well maybe the universe is trying to tell me something. So I looked into it. I read the reviews, did more research and read more reviews.  I figured, why not try it. I already feel horrible, it couldn't possibly get any worse. So I took the quiz, chatted with the doctors and was prescribed the estradiol and DHEA. Within the first two weeks, the hot flashes and night sweats stopped! I was pleasantly surprised. Then I slept all night for the first time in a long time. I thought, ok...this may be working. Fast forward to week 10...I feel pretty dang good! My mood has regulated and the joint pain is GONE! So maybe I'm not just getting old! I'm sleeping regularly and have more energy than I have in years. Slowly, I'm losing weight, nothing crazy but my clothes are fitting again. If you are kicking the idea around...just do it!
reply_paragraph: You are correct, Ali....the majority of women are woefully underprepared and uneducated about the impact the menopause transition can have on them. Joint aches, insomnia, hot flashes, mood swings, weight gain, etc., are all symptoms of fluctuating hormones. Menopause has historically been a taboo subject, but Winona is trying to change that!Women deserve to have their complaints validated, and they deserve to have their symptoms addressed!It's inspiring to us to read about your journey and how you've been able to regain control over your well-being. We are thrilled that you are feeling better now!Thank you for the 5 stars!

title: Comfort from symptoms but ...
paragraph: Comfort from symptoms but ...This would be a 5 star review if I felt like I was having better communications with the doctor assigned to me. The discussion with my doctor via the messaging system was a bit frustrating at times and I'm still unclear as to what the numbers of my dosage actually mean.  I don't need all of the medical jargon but I do like to understand the basics on why the formula should change based on remaining symptoms.  The lag in communication time also is a bit frustrating - - which makes it impossible to have a conversation.  Perhaps a "chat" service would work better than waiting 24 hours for the each of the few questions I had.  Even a dedicated doctor team would be helpful - - as it seems that mine is a full time doctor with a practice
reply_paragraph: We regret that your experience with our messaging system was frustrating, Raven!Clear and concise communication is very important to us as well, and we understand that an online platform may not always be easy to navigate.It is true that all of our doctors continue to maintain hospital and clinic hours in order to be up to date on the latest recommendations for menopause treatments. We value your input and will work to improve our communication processes to enhance the patient experience!However, we are happy to hear that your symptoms are resolving and that you are feeling better!A member of our Patient Care Team has emailed you for further support regarding your medication dosages :)

title: Wouldn‚Äôt recommend this program.
paragraph: I got Winona to help with my hot flashes and to lose some weight. They put me on some hormones to relieve the hot flashes and it did help them go away but I ended up getting my period back, which I didn‚Äôt want. And I never lost any weight. I went to my regular doctor and she was shocked that they don‚Äôt do any lab testing to see what‚Äôs the right amount of hormones to use. Overall I‚Äôm not happy with how my body is because of the way the hormones changed my body. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm only giving it 2 stars.
reply_paragraph: Thank you for your feedback, Angela.We're sorry that you did not have a good start to your HRT treatment program!Some women do get a random period, or a change in their period, upon starting therapy because your body is adjusting to the hormones. A little weight gain and bloating is also common in the beginning.  However, once your body is at the correct level of hormones, everything should return to normal. We encourage women to consistently take their HRT for at least 3 months before deciding to change their dosage or discontinue their medication.We are happy to hear that your hot flashes have resolved though!  Blood hormone levels change daily, sometimes from hour to hour, so blood testing is not medically recommended or needed.   HRT is prescribed based on symptoms.Every woman will respond differently, and your Winona doctor is happy to help you find just the right dose of HRT to help you see the results you are seeking. A member of our Patient Care Team has emailed you for further support.

HRT is not a weight loss drug, per se, but it can help to stop the hormonal weight gain so you can then focus on good habits to lose it. We're rooting for you!

paragraph: After one week of taking Winona HRT cream, my hip pain is gone, and mood is more stable.  I‚Äôm enjoying yoga and running without just bearing through the pain.  Thats‚Äôs just one week‚Ä¶can‚Äôt wait to the results a few months from now

title: Life changing...
paragraph: I researched for a long time to determine if HRT was the right move for me, I was nervous and very reluctant, because so many other systems and medicines failed me. But...I felt absolutely awful, and literally any symptom associated with menopause, I was having....and full on! I was at my wits end, not getting the sleep I needed, I was in major adrenal fatigue, every day was a struggle just to get up. First, I thought I would just answer the quiz, no commitment and I didn't pull the trigger on ordering my prescribed meds for roughly a week. I'm very holistic when it comes to putting meds in my body, I also have an autoimmune disease, so I have been able to control that naturally the last few years fairly well until my menopause symptoms began full force. Once I began the cream, I had some relief within a few days of noticeably fewer hot flashes, and I actually slept through the night....first time in months. One week later I started my DHEA, and at first had major stomach aches from the pills and bloating....but I was willing to stick with it. I've only been on my Rx's for two weeks, but already so many positives. I'll continue to see if the bloating improves, along with some weight loss....it's been a vicious cycle, but I feel like I'm finally on the right path to feeling like my old self again. Thank you Winona, the FB group, the support online, and the Drs. (at least mine) have been amazing...highly recommend to any woman in the throws of the menopause change!
reply_paragraph: Your feedback means a lot to us, Mriem!Menopause symptoms can be challenging, so we are glad you are finally feeling like you are on the right path, to finding full relief from your menopause symptoms. :)Our patient care team, as well as your Winona doctor, are always happy to assist you whenever you have questions or concerns. title: I talk only to an online doctor through‚Ä¶
paragraph: I talk only to an online doctor through a chat which may be a bot. You don‚Äôt take insurance so I‚Äôm overpaying.
reply_paragraph: We assure you, Leslie, that our doctors are real, board-certified doctors.  It can be hard to adjust to an an online platform for health care, but our doctors do not speak on the phone due to privacy restrictions.  All of our doctors continue to maintain hospital and clinic hours and cannot be assured that their conversations are protected on your end or their end.  We also understand that the cost of our treatments may seem high, and we do want Winona to be a cost-effective option. We strive to provide the best possible care, and some of the things that make us unique may help explain our prices.With no copay and free virtual doctor visits, follow-ups, and 24/7 messaging, we aim to alleviate costs that might otherwise apply. We also ship your treatments to you for free, always.While the final cost of your treatment program is dependent on what your Winona doctor determines that your body needs, you'll only ever pay for the medication itself without any other hidden fees. When compared to other products on the market, we believe that our treatment options are competitive in quality, safety, convenience, and cost.You can view all of our treatment options and their prices here: https://bywinona.com/shopWhile we're unable to bill your insurance company, you can use your HSA (Health Saving Account) and/or FSA (Flexible Spending Account) to pay for Winona prescriptions at checkout. We're also happy to provide you with purchase receipts that you may submit on your own to your health insurance company for possible reimbursement. Some private or employer-issued insurance providers may pay for Winona, but this is on a case-by-case basis, depending on your plan and deductible.A member of our Patient Care Team has emailed you for further support and direction.

title: Great solutions for an overlooked population!
paragraph: I had a complete hysterectomy/oophorectomy and was instantly thrown into menopause. Luckily my GYN put me on HRT right away (the patch). I did research on the detrimental consequences triggered by testosterone decline. Unfortunately, there are no FDA approved testosterone treatments for women and I don't feel comfortable having testosterone medication that is really designed for masc people. I felt DHEA would be a good solution. I've been on it for about 2 weeks. I cannot speak to changes in body composition (although I think my abdomen looks less "full" and my waist line looks slimmer - it filled out post-menopause). What I can speak on is how much more alert and energetic I am. I used to have to take a nap everyday and I would still fall alseep at night at an early hour. It felt like an monumental task to work all day, then come home and have to cook dinner or clean up. I also felt mentally slower.Not anymore. About a week after I started taking DHEA, I began to feel like the Energizer Bunny. I haven't felt this much pep since my early 30s (I'm 50 now).What I appreciated about Winona was that the online medical form captured all the info necessary for a doctor to make an informed decision on the therapy that would be best for you. Also, the doctor doesn't write an instant prescription. I've always questioned the sites that do that, like how much attention are you really putting into me if that is being done? I submitted my med info on a Saturday, the doctor got back to me on Monday and the meds were delivered about a week after that.The long ship time of the meds is the only thing I would complain about.
reply_paragraph: Thanks so much for your feedback, Jennifer!We, of course, always want to help any woman through her menopause journey, but it means even more to us when we can help a woman who has done her research and is cognizant of what menopause may mean for her (especially surgical menopause!)We know that women have other options for their HRT, so choosing Winona above those makes us so proud to assist you!It sounds like your fatigue was very debilitating and was impacting your life. title: You don‚Äôt have to suffer with this!
paragraph: I‚Äôve been in perimenopause for years and my doctor said I was ‚Äútoo young.‚Äù My mom had her last period at 41, aunt at 43, my grandma at 42 and my sister at 45. I‚Äôm 41 now and when I was 38 I went to my obgyn and he ran three separate types tests and all very expensive for autoimmune disorders, thyroid disorders/dysfunctions and my hormone levels. He explained that all tests came back ‚Äúnormal‚Äù and that although my hormone levels can FLUCTUATE DAILY he still believed I was too young to be experiencing menopause symptoms. I explained my family history and their ages of their last periods and he recanted the possibility of being too young with my family history but believed I was youthful enough I could handle some night sweats, irregular periods and hot flashes. He said if it was still very bad in another 6 months to a year to come back and we could run those tests again!!! Run them again?!?!?! You just told me they were useless as hormones fluctuate daily!!!!! I felt invisible in my own health care and completely defeated.With Winona I listed my symptoms and I wasn‚Äôt labeled a ‚Äúwhiny woman‚Äù with what‚Äôs wrong and bothering me. I was able to ask questions and express concerns. My concerns (does HRT cause cancer etc) I had researched already and had laid them to rest years ago when I saw my doctor but he wouldn‚Äôt listen. Winona listened to my symptoms (so many) and didn‚Äôt make me feel like there was an antiquated western medicine man waiting to tell me ‚Äúits just senile vagina and you‚Äôll be fine, there there‚Äù with a pat on the back and a large bill for more tests in my hand. Since I‚Äôve started my HRT, my hot flashes have diminished (not disappeared completely yet), my night sweats are getting more infrequent, my brain fog is clearing, and sudden bouts of anxiety are less frequent. If anything, they listened, and said let‚Äôs try this, see how we need to adjust and go from there. I couldn‚Äôt get anyone to listen to me before simply because my age wasn‚Äôt 50. My treatment is still new, less than a month, on HRT but I‚Äôm positive in my results so far and the future continuing them. I wish I would‚Äôve found Winona 3 years ago when I got the bravery to talk to my doctor and was shrugged off. You don‚Äôt have to suffer with this! Thank you Winona!
reply_paragraph: We absolutely hear you and see you, Stephanie!Your story deeply resonates with us because we frequently hear the same complaints from other women about being patronized, degraded, or treated with a condescending attitude by their personal doctors. Perimenopause symptoms can start in your 30's, and if they are bothersome to you, no matter how big or how small, you deserve to have them addressed!The lack of care and understanding in the medical community regarding women and menopause is the reason we were founded....there is no reason for anyone to suffer or to "see how you are in 6 months".Every day should be a good day, and you do not need to wait to get relief. We are so proud to support you!

title: There is a solution to menopause symptoms, Winona.
paragraph: I came upon Winona via social media as most people. I was skeptical and worried, but couldn't take my symptoms any more. I have always been of the mindset, what can it hurt, so I filled out the quiz and got set up with cream (50/50 Prog) and pill (25 DHEA). I am 10 weeks in and can see a huge difference for the better. My hot flashes and sleepless nights have almost disappeared completely. The first week I thought my eyes had corrected. I felt like I could see things more clearly and mind mind was working. That has calmed down and I do still feel brain fog and exhaustion. I am waiting to hear back from the doc, but hoping for an increase in strength to see if I can capture that first week feeling for longer. I have not had any of the negative effects. I haven't loss any hair nor gained any weight. I am excited for the future, now. Just try it. You may be pleasantly surprised.
reply_paragraph: We are just as excited for your future too, Brantlee!Getting our bioidentical HRT through an online platform can be unsettling and a little scary at first to some women, but we are here to support you every step of the way.Our treatments are safe, economical, and most importantly, effective!They can also be adjusted to fit your particular symptoms, so we are hopeful that you will find even more benefits as you work with your Winona doctor to fine tune your treatment plan. Thank you for your trust in us!

title: Easy to use.
reply_paragraph: The menopause transition is hard, Cindy, and we know that women want all of the symptoms to just go away!We make the process of getting you an individualized treatment plan as easy as possible!No more time consuming appointments, pharmacy lines, or juggling schedules!Thank you for the 5 stars!

We strive to provide you as much information and resources as we can so that you feel comfortable with your decision. We appreciate your recommendation and are proud to support you!

title: I was miserable
paragraph: I was miserable. I was having approximately 20 severe hot flashes a day.  I was sweating through my clothing and soaking the bed nightly.  I could not sleep due to the hot flashes.  After 3 weeks on Winona, I was down to maybe 1 or 2 a day and they were not bad.  Now, I have maybe one or two a week.  The only problem I am still having is getting the Weight off that I have put on. I am very pleased with the products overall!
reply_paragraph: Fantastic, Rebekah!Hot flashes are one of the most embarrassing symptoms to deal with because they are the most visible to the outside world. They always seem to randomly pop up at the most inconvenient times, and there is nothing we can do to stop them until they pass on their own. It sounds like you were dealing with a pretty severe pattern of them, so we are thrilled that you are seeing some relief now!However, we know the weight gain is frustrating and are hopeful that it will slow down for you!HRT is not magic, and the weight will not fall off on it's own,  but now that you are feeling better, it should be easier to work towards your goals.  Hang in there!

title: This was like magic overnight
paragraph: This was like magic overnight! I had so much trouble sleeping through the night. One week of taking Winona I was sleeping all the way through the night! My hot flashes have subsided and are just baby flashes now at 10 weeks! I extremely happy that I have found help!!!!
reply_paragraph: Our bioidentical HRT may seem like magic, but it is really just your body taking a big sigh of relief, Angelatuzzio!We are very confident in the effectiveness of our HRT, but it is still amazing to us every time how just a little dose of hormones can put women back on the path to feeling their best!Thank you so much for the 5 stars!

title: I was struggling with brain fog
paragraph: I was struggling with brain fog, messing up at work, pain in places that didnt make sense‚Ä¶ and the emotional roller coaster was awful. Winona helped me feel like myself again. Im not forgetting things and I have more energy. My mood is improved and i feel more stable.
reply_paragraph: Menopause symptoms can affect every system in your body, and brain fog seems to be the most scary one to deal with for a lot of women. Dealing with the hot flashes, joint pain, and fatigue is manageable (although not fun!)However, the brain fog and frustration at not being able to complete a sentence, or grasping at words, is not so easily compensated for. Women may even think they are entering the early stages of dementia!Estrogen plays a crucial role in cognition and brain health, so we are happy to hear that your HRT plan is working and that your hormone levels are improving.  Cheers to more clear thoughts!Thank you for your trust in us!

Patients agree to a subscription upon checkout and sign an agreement.  We are very clear and upfront about this. The only cost associated with your treatment plan is for the medication itself.  We do not charge you for the virtual doctor visit, follow-ups with the doctor, the ability to message your doctor, pharmacy fees, or subscription fees. We also ship your treatments to you for free, always.  Our Winona doctors are board-certified and specialize in the care of women going through the menopause transition.  They are professional, caring, and very astute at determining what type of care a woman may need. Asking questions is encouraged, but if our doctors do not feel that an online platform is appropriate for some patients, they are upfront about this so as not to waste anyone's time. We care about the health and safety of our patients, and take into account the appropriateness of each individual treatment plan because that is what we specialize in.  Each woman will have a different menopause journey, and we strive to provide customized care.  We are sorry if we are not the right fit for you!

title: Security Concerns
paragraph: HIPAA recommends any portal to have an auto logout when a patients session goes idle after some time. like how your bank does after you‚Äôve been inactive for a while. Winona‚Äôs web portal does not auto logout patients. A session was logged in for almost 12 hours. The system never once asked to reauthorization the users password when navigating to account info. The state ID and personal photo, required to establish an account, is not protected or hidden for privacy reasons. PII should not be viewable by default even in a logged in status.
reply_paragraph: We understand concerns surrounding internet security, J., so we take patient confidentiality very seriously and we prioritize the highest standard of data security, particularly concerning Protected Health Information (PHI).We employ cutting-edge encryption standards like AES-256 to secure data at rest and SSL/TLS encryption protocols to safeguard data in transit.Additionally, our meticulous key management protocols and authentication mechanisms ensure precise control over access to sensitive information.With Winona's integration of AWS services and stringent network security measures, including Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) isolation, patients can trust that their data is protected against unauthorized access and breaches.We are disheartened to think that you may fear a security issue.A member of our Patient Care Team  has emailed you for further details.

Other creams and potions that are sold over the counter contain a fraction of the dose of hormones needed to be effective. In the case where some creams contain real, active hormones, the dose is negligent. They may also contain hormone precursors that sound impressive but aren't actually active in the body. Our bioidentical HRT is approximatley 10 times stronger than over the counter creams, is compounded specifically to your needs, and is made with FDA approved ingredients. You deserve safe, quality, and effective HRT, and we thank you for your trust in us!

title: No one from the company tested me to‚Ä¶
paragraph: No one from the company tested me to actually see which hormone I was low in. They just went off the questions and didn't look at levels. I talked to the Dr. No real questions asked. She approved. 3 days on increased mg per the dr's instruction to do 3 pumps instead of 2 while i wait for updated prescription to come in. I ended up in the er due a hellacios migraine, puking, dizzy, soapy taste in my mouth and not able to use my right hand. The er dr said do not take the cream. 2 days later I got into my chiropractor for the migraine adjustment.  He tested me for the need of estrogen/progesterone cream. I did not need it. He also said do not take. Lesson learned.  Do not take anything unless you are tested first.  I will not ever recommend or support this online company or any company that does not check levels first.
reply_paragraph: Tammy, we apologize for any frustration, but your Winona doctor did communicate back and forth with you several times regarding your symptoms and your request to adjust your medications. Blood hormone levels can vary greatly from day-to-day, so blood tests are not necessarily an accurate indication of what you might need. Bloodwork can appear "perfect" on paper, but you still may have symptoms.In accordance with NAMS and ACOG, bloodwork is not needed to prescribe HRT.  It is, therefore, prescribed based on symptoms and medical history. Your Winona doctor did provide guidance and suggestions for you and explained that it can take time for you body to adjust to the hormones. The menopause transition can have lots of ups and downs along the way, and that is why our doctors check in with you periodically to provide any adjustments that you may need. You did not respond back to her regarding her suggestions and instead canceled your account. We wish you the best!

title: Trust the Process
paragraph: I feel like menopause hit me over night. One minute I was at the top of my athletic career , the next minute I have all these weird injuries, I have no endurance and I standing in the mirror, asking myself "where did all this body fat come from?" I was having at least 10-15 hot flashes a day and night sweats were 1.5- 2 hrs apart, my sleep was horrible , so after about 4 hrs of interrupted sleep, why bother anymore, I would just get up and start another long day . Then after some research and having that talk with myself - I decided to give Winona a try.  I joined the face book group and read postings everyday, It helped me stay the course when I felt like it wasn't working at times.  So my advise is stay the course, they suggest give it 8-10 weeks. Be patient, this is a whole new you. I am at 10 weeks and I am sleeping so hard. I wake up so refreshed. My night sweats havens been around for about 4 weeks now, I only get a hot flash from time to time but I have found some food triggers them . My evil now is chocolate, hot sauce and fried foods. The DHEA makes me feel like the energizer bunny when I take it mid morning. I'm still trying to adjust my macros/ meals and timings to see what works best for me now as the DHEA suppresses my appetite- Cream at night before bed.  My weight training is going well- lifting heavier. I love cardio so that's getting better again. I did gain 8lbs it seemed like over night - working on that both mentally and physically.  I do feel there is a light at the end of the tunnel and I will get back to my ole self with the help of Winona products.
reply_paragraph: Thanks for sharing your experience, Morgan!As you discovered, even when you eat all the right things and work out consistently, menopause symptoms can still throw you for a loop!What worked before does not help at all, and it can feel like your body is betraying you!We love that you are finding a whole new you and that you are listening to your body's cues about what it does and does not like. Starting HRT can definitely give your body the hormone balance that it is craving, but we must still do our part to work with it, and you are doing fantastic! We applaud your self-awareness and commitment to yourself!

title: HRT from Winona has literally changed‚Ä¶
paragraph: HRT from Winona has literally changed my life. I‚Äôve been going through perimenopause for a couple of years, not really realizing that‚Äôs what it was. I was angry at my husband all of the time, for no reason! I had terrible night sweats and hot flashes. With the night sweats, I was getting no sleep, so that just compounded everything else. And of course, I was gaining weight with each year that passed. When my night sweats got so bad that I basically wasn‚Äôt sleeping at all, I knew something had to change. A Winona ad came across my IG so I decided to look into it and HRT in general. Winona made it so easy to get. The instructions said it could take 90 days to get relief, but I had relief within literally days! My hot flashes and night sweats ceased within the first week. I felt a noticeable difference in my mood. I felt hopeful and happy for the first time in two years. I felt like I had awoken from a terrible dream. I just finished my third month and I am a different person. My skin even looks so much better and healthier. My husband says I‚Äôm a different person! I‚Äôm so thankful I found Winona and took the leap. It‚Äôs an easy process and is affordable. I‚Äôll never be without!
reply_paragraph: We are so humbled and grateful to be able to help you, Shelly!The vast majority of women are not prepared for the life-altering changes that accompany their menopause transition.  Symptoms can affect every system in our body and leave us angry, confused, and feeling betrayed.  Our loved ones often don't understand or know how to help either. In addition to a lack of dependable information for women, there is an even greater lack of doctors willing to help women deal with their symptoms. Winona is trying to change that!We do recommend allowing 10-12 weeks for your body to adjust to the influx of hormones, so we are thrilled that you started to see major improvement so soon....that is a testament to how much your body was craving a balance of hormones. Thank you so much for trusting us with your HRT!

title: HRT TREATMENT/Peri menopause
paragraph: I had unexplained weight gain, extreme fatigue, night sweats, insomnia, very irritable and severe feelings of depression. My libido was non-existent and my emotions mimicked what I felt like post pardum depression with my children. My dr. Just wanted to put me on antidepressants, which would in turn only mask my symptoms and make my libido even lower. I researched hormonal treatment and found WINONA. The Dr‚Äôs actually listened and we started bio identical hormone replacement therapy. I‚Äôve been on them for 13 months and I feel like myself again. All my symptoms have disappeared. I sleep through the night, my mind is clear, my emotional state is back to normal and I‚Äôm even starting to lose the weight I‚Äôve gained. My libido is back too! I cannot recommend them enough. You don‚Äôt have to be miserable going through perimenopauseüòâ
reply_paragraph: Thank you, Nadia for your feedback!You are correct! There is no need to suffer! Menopause symptoms can be challenging to say the least. Weight gain, low libido, trouble sleeping and night sweats, are just a few of those horrible symptoms. Our doctors listen to you and they will always do all they can to help you feel so much better. :)We are always here for you!

paragraph: Three months into using Winona for menopause, and I can say that the transformation has been incredible. The impact on my quality of life has been profound, offering relief that I couldn‚Äôt have imagined was possible.  It‚Äôs more than a treatment; it‚Äôs the key to regaining control and joy in your life.

title: I started to bleed after 2 1/2 years of‚Ä¶
paragraph: I started to bleed after 2 1/2 years of menopause. Not a good time. My doctor advised me to stop.
reply_paragraph: We are sorry that you were not happy with your HRT treatment plan, Julie. Our Winona doctor was not aware of your frustration or concerns until you completed your 10 week Follow Up.  Sometimes women can have a cycle again upon starting HRT, and this is normal. When a woman has low levels of hormones for a while, and then introduces them again, it can trigger your body into having a cycle. However, the initial periods often go away.  We understand that it is frustrating though!  Our Winona doctors are available for any questions or concerns you have along the way and to reassure you of the changes you may experience.

title: OB-GYN offered zero help, so I was desperate!
paragraph: After an appt with an OB-GYN where all my permimenopause symptoms were dismissed and ignored, and I was told there was nothing I could do UNTIL I hit menopause, I was feeling really bad. I felt I needed to advocate for myself by finding BHRT somewhere else. I'd seen ads on Instagram for By Winona, so I went to their website to investigate what they could offer. I was shocked at how easy a process it was to get bioidentical hormone replacement therapy tailored to my symptoms. Within a day or two my cream was shipped. I told my primary care physician what I was doing and what my experience had been with the OB-GYN and he's been nothing but supportive. We're going to run labs every few months just to stay on top of my health. But the truth is, I feel fantastic! I was really suffering from inflammation, puffiness, hair loss, skin issues, vagina problems, extreme fatigue, trouble sleeping, and brain fog. I was getting random things like issues in my shoulder and neck and now those are all gone. The inflammation went away within DAYS of starting the cream. The other symptoms have taken a bit longer to resolve. I did have about a week of dryness down there, but I just lessened the cream dose and it went away! I'm back to my regular dose without issues so my body must just have been adjusting to the hormonal changes. I am so grateful to have found Winona!
reply_paragraph: And we are so grateful to be able to help you, Rachel!We are saddened to hear that your OB/GYN was not able, or not willing, to help you. Everyone knows about the brain fog, insomnia, and hot flashes, but menopause symptoms affect every system in our body, including skin, hair, and joints!Isn't it amazing how just a couple drops of HRT cream can make you feel like yourself again?!!

title: Life Changing Perimenopause Relief
paragraph: I first heard about Winona through my nutritionist and then listened to a Winona webinar. They took the time to answer every single one and there were many situations to address.I then decided to do the online consultation. My situation, like everyone's is unique because I had a partial hysterectomy and have one ovary left. Since my period stopping wasn't an indicator and I wasn't having night sweats or hot flashes, I had no idea how I could tell if I was in perimenopause. Their symptom guide and intake form were very thorough in helping you think through all the symptoms related to menopause whether you realized that's what they were or not! You also fill in your personal questions for the doctor and what type of treatment options you are interested in.You have to upload some personal information like a photo, a copy of your ID, and payment information. Then after you submit it takes a day or two to have a doctor review your information and prescribe your products. The only thing I wish they did differently is ask you to approve your products before processing them. I received my cream and supplements within a few days. I started the cream first for about a week and it has truly been life-changing. I'm sleeping more soundly and my mood is much better regulated. I forgot the cream one day and I could really tell a difference, particularly in my mood. I'm just now starting the supplement and think it's too soon to offer additional feedback on it. I'm so grateful for the Winona team for developing this medically backed resource for menopause!
reply_paragraph: We appreciate your feedback so much, Lily!  It makes us so proud to know that other health disciplines and care providers, such as Nutritionists, are educating women about the menopause transition!And you are correct....each woman will have a very unique health history and intensity of symptoms.  Our onboarding questionnaire is designed to address your concerns and help you and your Winona doctor devise the best treatment plan for you. reply_paragraph: We are sorry that you did not enjoy your experience at Winona, Monica!Blood hormone levels can vary greatly from day-to-day, so blood tests are not necessarily an accurate indication of what you might need. Bloodwork can appear "perfect" on paper, but you still may have symptoms.HRT is, therefore, traditionally prescribed based on symptoms and medical history. We want you to feel better, not necessarily "fix" your lab values.It does take some time, often around 3 months, to see the best results, especially for the weight gain to stabilize.We are sorry to see that you canceled early :(Your Winona doctor is always willing to work with you to find the right dose of HRT for you based on your feedback.
