title: Chinese Medicine Doctoral Student Chose BHRT over Herbal Medicine
paragraph: I am a Chinese medicine doctoral student. Naturally, my first inclination was to make lifestyle and diet changes first when menopause symptoms arrived in January 2024 and my body went haywire with hot flashes, night sweats etc. I adopted a vegan whole food plant based diet as well as swimming and was able to reduce 90 percent of my symptoms. However, the remaining 10 percent of symptoms were still interrupting my daily functioning. Chinese herbs are not as robust as BHRT in treating menopausal symptoms. I am not saying that they can‚Äôt be effective as an option, It would just take time for them to begin to address your symptoms. In addition, you would need to have access to a practitioner who could create a custom formulation for you. As insurance companies do not cover Chinese herbal medicine, many practitioners do not prescribe them. Menopause is complex and presents risk factors for women that include bone health, cardiovascular health etc. So, I opted for BHRT via Winona knowing that I could still supplement with herbs at a later time as well as continue to utilize acupuncture while utilizing BHRT. The process was straightforward and simple. I consulted with a doctor. Got my prescription in days. 3 weeks in my symptom severity has reduced. I chose cream for delivery of estrogen and progesterone because i swim and was worried about wearing a patch. I also was prescribed DHEA. As my body continues to adjust to BHRT, I expect by the time I have my follow up appointment, I will be entirely symptom free. I have not experienced any side effects to date from BHRT. Once I have been on Winona BHRT for a year, I can make a decision as to whether I need to supplement with Chinese herbal medicine or not. As Chinese herbs used to treat menopause symptoms may have an estrogenic effect, you would not want to take them initially when you begin BHRT. If you decide BHRT is right for you, I highly recommend using Winona. The process is a breeze, pricing is reasonable, and their prescriptions are high quality. It is not necessary to suffer with symptoms when BHRT can help you make a smoother menopause transition. Taking the plunge still requires that you maintain a nutrient dense diet and active lifestyle.

We appreciate your trust in us, as your review helps other women to  know that they don't have to suffer!

title: Don‚Äôt be fooled by the marketing
paragraph: Winona is almost a scam. They don‚Äôt have anything special to offer except a pretty website. This company makes a lot of promises about helping you quickly and providing specialized medicines, but it‚Äôs not true. All they really do is send your information to a doctor pool (some random doctor calls you days later) and then they ship you their branded hormones. Nothing is specially designed or mixed just for you; you just choose a couple of their premade options. So don‚Äôt be fooled by the marketing! Take the time to Google for a women‚Äôs health specialist in your state who offers telehealth calls. A regular doctor can see you right away, quicker than Winona, and a regular doctor can choose from many available medications on the market that are right for you, not just one proprietary product. When I pointed out these things to Winona‚Äôs customer service agent they replied, ‚ÄúI have made no promises to you‚Äù and removed my name from the doctor pool request.
reply_paragraph: We are sorry, Elsie, but we are unable to locate an account under your name.As we provide prescription medications, we must comply with state licensing requirements and have a board certified and  licensed doctor on our team who is licensed to prescribe in your state.  You are not assigned to a random doctor. Our compounded creams are also not premade.  They are made at the time your Winona doctor prescribes them, in the amount that you need, to address your specific symptoms. Not every woman will qualify for an HRT treatment plan, so if you were not accepted as a patient, your potential doctor did not deem you a good fit for our online platform.

title: Winona has been more helpful than my‚Ä¶
paragraph: Winona has been more helpful than my GP. I feel like I have a trusted partner in my menopause journey. Doctor is very responsive and answers any questions. only wish there was a way to order tests and track hormone levels.
reply_paragraph: Thanks so much for your feedback, R.C.!We do understand your concern about tracking hormone levels, but blood tests are not needed and are not recommended for a treatment plan. Hormone levels can vary greatly from day-to-day, so blood tests are not necessarily an accurate indication of what you might need. Bloodwork can appear "perfect" on paper, but you still may have symptoms.Your body is more sensitive than a lab test, so if you are having symptoms, then your hormone levels are fluctuating. HRT is, therefore, prescribed based on symptoms and medical history. We want you to feel better, not necessarily "fix" your lab values.We are so happy to help guide you through your menopause journey, so please reach out to your Winona doctor anytime you have a question or concern :)

title: Hard to know where to start
paragraph: Hard to know where to start.  I'm 53 this year...I started experiencing perimenopause symptoms when I was 42.  In the last couple of years my symptoms became unmanageable yet my "numbers" always show I'm in the "average" range and not in perimenopause.  It's maddening when your doctor tells you that feeling this way is just part of being a woman.  I had put on 40 pounds in less than 6 months with zero lifestyle or dietary changes.  I couldn't sleep, night sweats were horrible.   I decided after 2 YEARS of struggling to try Winona...I'm only a few weeks in but within 2 days I slept through the night for the first time in recent memory...night sweats greatly decreased...the biggest change has been in my energy level  I feel like the "blinders" came off.  I'm so excited to see what is to come after a couple more months using Winona.  So far, this has drastically improved my quality of life.  I have nothing to gain by posting this.  My hope is that other women like me can find the same life changing relief I have.  I come from a family of pharmacists and doctors.   I don't just go rogue and try whatever.   My decision to take my female health was borne of desperation...but I did my research first.  I can't say enough how impressed I am with Winona and the results I have achieved so far.  I cannot wait to see what happens after a couple of months.
reply_paragraph: We are truly humbled by your kind words, Sallie, and only wish that you had found Winona sooner!Unfortunately, there seems to be a pervasive, apathetic, and resigned societal reaction to any woman who complains about menopause symptoms....even from their own doctor!  Women do not need to suffer!Bloodwork can, indeed, be perfect on paper, but symptoms may still be severe and impact your quality of life. It IS  maddening when no one will listen!We are overjoyed that your symptoms are starting to resolve so quickly and that you are feeling so much better.....a testament to how much your body needed to replenish those hormones :)

title: Sweet relief
paragraph: I have been to a few doctors since my hysterectomy in 2020, and I have not found any relief for my menopause symptoms because most are geared towards natural menopause. I finally found Winona and the process was easy, I felt like they listened and I finally have a feeling of normalcy. The first week I already have less anxiety, I sleep through the night and I have lost a whole pants size. My energy is back and I‚Äôm not cranky. Thank you from the bottom of my heart.
reply_paragraph: As you experienced, Dana, surgical menopause tends to create more severe and longer lasting symptoms. Women are woefully underprepared for what to expect during a natural menopause transition, and even less so with a surgical transition. We are thrilled that you found us and that you are finally feeling like yourself again!

paragraph: I've been using Winona for over a year and it's been life-changing. Perimenopause snuck up on me, and the person I was becoming did not feel like me. Then the night sweats and hot flashes. I tried over the counter pills and whatnot because I didn't want to admit the issue. I was also afraid, taking hormone replacement was an unknown. After lots of Internet surfing I decided to watch all of the Winona videos, read the reviews, and finally said, I need to do something. The process itself was easy and quick. Honestly, it's one of the best decisions I've made. I took control over my body and mind again. I've had to have my prescription adjusted once, and even that was simple! Once you decide, everything else follows.
reply_paragraph: We are so proud of you, LM, for being an advocate for yourself and realizing you don't have to just accept perimenopause symptoms!The menopause transition can start as early as in one's 30's, so a lot of women do not expect it or attribute their symptoms to something else.We want women to know that there is help available, and we encourage them to take that leap to HRT because it can lead you back to yourself!Thank you so much for your support!

title: It‚Äôs probably easier to get cocaine‚Ä¶
paragraph: It‚Äôs probably easier to get cocaine than HTR.  I was skeptical at first . Worried they were going to tell me 46 is too young and try to sell me some crap I didn‚Äôt need. I‚Äôve seen numerous doctors for the past several years for insomnia without any relief. Sleep study, total waste. Here, take Bezos or antidepressants, was a common solution. Started with severe night sweats at age 38.  Those went away but then other symptoms began later such as vaginal atrophy, pretty bad. Gyno gave estrogen cream but I had to use much more than recommended for relief. Began having night sweats again recently and hot flashes. Had been to two hormone specialists who wouldn‚Äôt prescribe estradiol. ‚ÄúNot until after menopause‚Äù.  If you‚Äôre like me, do you realize how much suffering a woman will go through before being ‚Äúeligible‚Äù in their eyes? My biggest concern of all was debilitating brain fog.  I was so concerned I would have early dementia.  I had even forgotten the spelling of my last name once, a name I‚Äôve had my whole life! Couldn‚Äôt sleep couldn‚Äôt think totally miserable but recently I‚Äôve been feeling better.  Got on with Winona and started the oral estradiol. It‚Äôs amazing that I am beginning to sleep again, brain fog is lifting and I just feel better!  The weird things my heart was doing has stopped too! Don‚Äôt need any messy creams for atrophy anymore. I was happy they had set me up with a real Dr who has been great so far.  The meds shipped right away. So far so good! My only regret is not starting sooner! This has saved my life, dramatic perhaps but I was feeling incredibly hopeless. Depressed as hell too. Thank you Winona!
reply_paragraph: Oh Star Dazer....you are the perfect picture of what women going through peri/menopause feel like before they find relief!We are so sorry that your symptoms and complaints were ignored for so long.  As you discovered, symptoms can start in your 30's and last for as long as 20 years.  Medical associations including the American Medical Association and the North American Menopause Society agree that it is safe for women under 60 to start HRT and continue as long as needed when monitored appropriately. Our doctors specialize in peri/menopause treatment, and one of our top goals is to let women know they don't have to jump through all those hoops of unnecessary testing, medications, and gas lighting.Your review helps to let other women know there is help available and they are worthy of good health. Thanks so much for trusting us with your HRT!

In the case where these Amazon creams contain real, active hormones, the dose is negligent. In some cases, these creams also contain hormone precursors that sound impressive but aren't actually active in the body. A Patient Care Representative has emailed you for further support!

paragraph: Love, love, love these bioidentical hormones from  Winona! reply_paragraph: We are so grateful that you decided to give Winona a try, Julia!Blood hormone levels can vary greatly from day-to-day, so blood tests are not necessarily an accurate indication of what you might need. HRT is, therefore, prescribed based on symptoms and medical history. We want you to feel better, not necessarily "fix" your lab values.We are sorry that your previous doctor put you through all of that unnecessary testing and wasted your money!However, your review helps other woman to avoid the same frustrating experience and to know that there is safe, effective, and affordable HRT treatment through Winona!We thank you for your support and are thrilled that you are feeling better!

title: Hoping for great results!
paragraph: Update 2/20/24: I wanted to update this because I did have some success once I posted this review, but it shouldn‚Äôt take a bad review to get support. Right after my post, I received direct outreach from a great rep who let me know that I wasn‚Äôt hearing back from my doctor because they had apparently quit and the notification hadn‚Äôt gone out to folks who needed to know. I was immediately reassigned a new doctor, who promptly reached out. I was also finally able to get to speak with a pharmacist, which was helpful but still didn‚Äôt entirely answer my question about equivalencies between the cream and patch but at least I‚Äôm getting somewhere. Deciding to give ByWinona a chance and see if this can help me. Original post: Like myself, many women will already be taking HRT and may be switching to the cream product to address possible absorption issues (e.g., poor absorption of the estradiol patch). However, it is necessary to understand the equivalent dosages between the different types of HRT (tablets, cream, gel, spray or patch). Despite multiple messages in to By Winona to find out from a doctor how the 2.5 mg cream compares in strength to my .1 estradiol patch, I heard back once, early on, and it did not answer my question. I was assured by customer service agents that I would get an answer and it has been weeks with no answer. The concern that brought me to Winona is either that I‚Äôm not absorbing well with the .1 patch or the dosage is too low since I‚Äôve been on this strength for some time. So, if the 2.5 mg cream is actually equivalent to a .1 patch or  less than a .1 patch, the cream will likely do me no good. I like the convenience of being able to quickly access HRT online but do not like not having access to medical professionals for easy questions.
reply_paragraph: Hello Jo!We are unable to locate you as a patient under this name. We will do all we can to ensure you receive the answers to your questions. :)Please reach out to us as your earliest convenience. Our Patient Care Team will promptly assist you.

title: My therapist mentioned this company‚Ä¶
paragraph: My therapist mentioned this company after hearing me talk about my symptoms and how frustrated I was with my primary doctor. The doctor that was assigned to me also made me feel relieved to hear that she was working with Winona because she was also tried and frustrated with the medical field and the lack of help women had at this stage in life to help find some relief. I explained to her my responses from my doctors and how I was to just deal with it. Why did the medical field has so many options for males but none for women. I was really happy to hear how she wanted to help make a change in the field for us women out there who are struggling with menopause. I am only on my first week of taking the prescribe meds. The shipped to my house with no issues. Keeping fingers crossed that this helps.

Peri/menopause symptoms can be devastating, and, you are correct, no one prepares women for them!  Our society has a high tolerance for women's suffering and our goal is to change that. Wanted to give me a RX for depression ???   Then I saw a Winona commercial the woman had my symptoms and I had a lightbulb moment I was in menopause!!!  I took the leap, so happy I did most of my symptoms have vanished almost 3 months in.  What I am MOST Impressed with is the care and communication I get from Dr. Green in a 24hr turnaround time that's insane it is quicker then any doctor I've EVER seen.Thanks you for being woman's health advocates especially now in this crazy world.
reply_paragraph: We are so humbled by your review, Renee! Unfortunately, we hear a lot of women say that their doctors want to give them antidepressants.  You don't have a deficiency of Prozac....you have a deficiency of Estrogen!   Dr. Green, and ALL of our Winona doctors, know that we are sometimes a last resort for women who are frustrated, tired, angry, and overwhelmed with symptoms but get no answers from their doctors as to why they feel that way. Or worse, they are just outright ignored!  As you have experienced, bloodwork can appear perfect on paper, but that is just a snapshot in time.  Hormones fluctuate (hello hot flash!), so HRT is prescribed based on your specific symptoms.  We want you to FEEL better, regardless of what your bloodwork shows. Symptoms are real, and you deserve to be able to manage them if they are impacting your life.  Thank you for trusting us!

title: This is about the customer service and onboarding process.
paragraph: I have yet to actually get the treatments recommended by the doctor but I had to take a moment to rate the experience I had up to now. I had zero trouble getting a treatment plan and it was done so fast I had no idea it was even looked at by a doctor. I've never done anything like this online before so for all I knew it could take weeks. I went through the onboarding process and it was reviewed and approved by the doctor. A few days later I went to check the progress and was surprised to find that there had been a problem totally on my end with a payment. I worked with a rep named Erin out of Birmingham Al and they were so sweet and so helpful, even when I had a lot of questions and concerns. They were just so nice and no matter how stupid I felt my questions were they just handled it all so efficiently. I am now excitedly waiting to see how the treatment works for me and will come and do another review on that aspect. If you are reading this and on the fence about trying it, just go for it. It is so easy to do but if you have trouble they are right there to help walk you through it.
reply_paragraph: Thank you Jenn! Our patient care team works hard to be of assistance and Erin does a fantastic job helping everyone she comes in contact with! Thank you for your sweet words about her! We would love to hear how you are doing once you actually get started! Don't forget that your Winona doctor is just a message away for any help and support as well!

title: I have never written an unsolicited‚Ä¶
paragraph: I have never written an unsolicited review but the way this company has changed my life I want to shout from the top of the mountain! I am 56 and my meno journey up to now was pretty easy.  Didn‚Äôt have a lot of hot flashes and while I have PCOS I was thrilled to be done with heavy bleeding.Then my libido completely shut down and I started gaining weight literally overnight.  I started to ramp up my workouts and while my weight stabilized, it was not coming off. When I saw an ad I was at my lowest.  Mood swings were as bad as they had ever been, anxiety was constant and I had zero energy.  When I tell you it has only been a WEEK and I already feel better - I never would have believed it.  The process was easy, and while it took about a week to get my products, I am THRILLED that I did. I am already thinking about sex again, my energy is through the roof, my skin is not as dry as it was and I can‚Äôt wait to use the blossom cream! Thank You for what you do for a generation of women suffering silently.
reply_paragraph: Gretchen, your story is amazing! We appreciate you taking the time to find us here and leave a glowing review. It sounds like you are glowing too and we love haring that! Please keep us posted on your journey!

title: The "follow-up" appointment I just‚Ä¶
paragraph: The "follow-up" appointment I just completed was a bit of a joke. Asking three questions - "Do you like Winona, yes or no? Do you want to up your prescription, yes or no? Do you want to continue your prescription, yes or no?" This bare bones assessment is nowhere near nuanced enough determine if the treatment is working. I don't KNOW if I'm on the right prescription ... I would hope that there would be more in-depth questions and dialogue with a medical professional to work together to get the best results. You need more than YES or NO questions and the patient shouldn't be the driver on whether to continue at current levels or not.
reply_paragraph: We apologize for any dissatisfaction you may have with the follow-up questions. The purpose of these questions is to provide a quick and convenient way for you to update your doctor on how you are responding to your current treatment plan.We recognize the importance of receiving more comprehensive care, which is why your Winona doctor is accessible to you through the patient portal. You can reach out to them at any time if you have any questions or concerns.If you would like to discuss your treatment plan with your Winona doctor, please don't hesitate to send them a message. They will be more than happy to assist you. Your doctor values your satisfaction with the care you receive and wants to ensure you are well taken care of. :)

title: I use the cream daily and religiously‚Ä¶
paragraph: I use the cream daily and religiously every evening. I've been on it for over a year. My life has changed dramatically. I'm 46 and still having periods. However, about three years ago my mood and hot flashes made me something I didn't like. I tried talking to a gynecologist and had tests completed. The answer kept coming back to low dose birth control. My gut told me to keep researching and learn more. I'm glad I chose Winona. The only reason I didn't give it a full 5 stars is that the cream rubs off very easily leaving marks on your clothes. I had to stop using it in the morning before work. The cream does not stain. Just annoying. Like invisible vs no. Invisible deodorant. I now set my alarm in the evenings to make sure the cream is applied.
reply_paragraph: Thanks for your feedback, Lisa!  Our creams are designed to be rapidly absorbed by your skin, so we are dismayed to hear that yours is leaving  marks on your clothes.  This is not an occurrence we usually hear about.  A member of our Patient Care team will be contacting you shortly to gather more details. Thank you for your patience!

paragraph: Absolutely LOVE WINONA! I was on Biote (pellets) for over a year and it was never consistent  after each injection not to mention Biote is expensive ($400 every 3 months) and invasive. We are proud to offer our bioidentical HRT in pill, patch, and cream form without the extra hassle of doctor appointments, surgical procedures, and inconsistent results. reply_paragraph: We understand, Maya, that it is frustrating to not be able to receive Testosterone from Winona.  Testosterone is a controlled substance and there are restrictions around its use, especially when it comes to online prescriptions. Testosterone therapy also requires routine bloodwork. While we don't offer testosterone therapy, we do provide DHEA (Dehydroepiandrosterone) therapy, as a safer alternative with similar benefits! We are happy that you are feeling better though with your current treatment plan! We hope that you will stay with us in the future :)

paragraph: Finding By Winona has been a godsend. Prior to getting in touch with them, I had been suffering, for over 8 years, with hot flashes, insomnia, and weight gain. Menopause was wrecking my life. I no longer felt like myself. I felt as if I was falling apart over night. So, I started buying every reputable product I could find on the market. I was desperate. And, I would get some relief, but never enough for me to recommend any of the products to someone else. However, By Winona is different. It is the REAL DEAL! I have gone from taking a plethora of products each day, down to 2 therapies a day (1 pill and a topical cream). You have nothing to lose and everything to gain by trying their products. I assure you. You will not be disappointed.

title: I reported high blood pressure readings‚Ä¶
paragraph: I reported high blood pressure readings after 2 months of HRT. I took it upon myself to stop the estradiol and after 4 days my Bp day by day dropped baby to normal. The doctor advised me to start the estradiol and that the Bp was ‚Äúnot that high‚Äù. For reference, I am 40 years old & my Bp averages: 115-120/60-70. I was experiencing symptoms of high Bp which prompted me to start checking again. At my worst feeling (dizzy, hot face, short breaths) my reading was 135/79 (high for me) In the days after my readings regulated back to ‚Äúnormal‚Äù (check every morning for comparison) 128/80120/73116/61Ladies- be mindful and don‚Äôt fall for ageism during a late night social media scroll. Get your labs checked.
reply_paragraph: Hello! Our HRT products, rarely cause severe side effects as they are bioidentical. Our products help most women however, HRT is not for everyone. That is why Winona doctors are available 7 days a week in the patient portal :) That is a great question!Blood hormone levels can vary greatly from day-to-day, so blood tests are not necessarily an accurate indication of what you might need. Bloodwork can appear "perfect" on paper, but you still may have symptoms.HRT is, therefore, prescribed based on symptoms and medical history. We want you to feel better, not necessarily "fix" your lab values.

reply_paragraph: We understand that menopause symptoms can be challenging and we apologize that you are still experiencing them despite starting Hormone Replacement Therapy (HRT).We want to remind you that it can take time to achieve full and lasting relief with HRT, as every person's body reacts differently.To support you through this process, we offer free, continuous support with one of our Winona doctors who can work with you to find the dosage that works best for you.If you would like to discuss your treatment plan with your doctor, you can message them directly through the patient portal here: https://app.bywinona.com/message

title: Life Changing!
paragraph: The past couple of years have been a struggle, to say the least. There have been so many symptoms I don't know where to begin- but none of them were awesome. They were different from the normally discussed hot flashes and night sweats. Some of these symptoms were weight gain, fatigue, brain fog, libido changes,  irritability, and the list goes on. I was telling my friend what I was going through and she told me about Winona. I researched, I tried it, now I'm singing the praise. Winona has been life changing me me. In a world where there is little information about Menopause and the symptoms one may experience, It is nice to feel heard and understood and to know that there is help! Winona has been there.I have absolutely loved this experience!

title: Too expensive found better elsewhere
paragraph: Dr Dombo didn‚Äôt answer 2 of my questions. One was potentially serious. The other was cost related. I ended up finding a compounding pharmacy that cut my costs down by 75% for the prescription and the Dr visits to an ND are on an as needed basis. Both of which are still covered by FSA. I think this service is convenient and quick but is lacking in the responsiveness and is too costly for most.
reply_paragraph: We understand that the cost of our treatments may seem high, and we do want Winona to be a cost-effective option. Thanks to our own compounding pharmacies, we're able to formulate our treatments specifically for the needs of each unique patient. This means that you can trust that any medication prescribed to you by your Winona doctor is informed by your symptoms and circumstances alone. With no copay and free virtual doctor visits, follow-ups, and 24/7 messaging, we aim to alleviate costs that might otherwise apply. We also ship your treatments to you for free, always.When compared to other products on the market, we believe that our treatment options are competitive in quality, safety, convenience, and cost.While we're unable to bill your insurance company, you can use your HSA (Health Saving Account) and/or FSA (Flexible Spending Account) to pay for Winona prescriptions at checkout. We're also happy to provide you with purchase receipts that you may submit on your own to your health insurance company for possible reimbursement. Some private or employer-issued insurance providers may pay for Winona, but this is on a case-by-case basis, depending on your plan and deductible.

title: Fed up in Florida
paragraph: I'm a 54 year old female who was suffering with chronic hot flashes 24 hours a day. It really started to have a domino affect on all aspects of my life: sleep, intimacy, cognitive abilities, mood, and mental health.  I was desperate for an answer and didn't know quite where to turn. I saw your ad on Facebook and decided to give it a try. Why? Ease of communication with staff including the physician, quick process in signing up, the reviews from other patients and affordability.  I received my shipment in a week or so and took all 3 of my prescriptions that evening as is my normal medication routine. I'm telling you the absolute truth when I say I suffered not one more hot flash since.  NOT ONE MORE! The Doctor was successful in knowing exactly what I needed for my age, weight, and height and I'm forever grateful for their and Wynona's help. I'm not saying that everyone will have the same response as I, but they have sure made a believer out of me. I'm generally a cynical type of gal and like physical proof. I'm so glad I took this leap of faith and encourage everyone who suffers as well to sign up. Thank you Wynona.

paragraph: I started Perimenopausal symptoms at 51 and had my last period a year later. My GP & Ob-GYN didn't seem interested in helping so I looked for alternatives. I started Winona 90 days a ago. reply_paragraph: Hi! We understand that this can be a difficult and frustrating situation.It's worth noting that while your body adjusts to the HRT, it is not uncommon to experience bloating and water weight gain. However, it's important to note that weight gain is not directly linked to HRT. In fact, studies suggest that the use of HRT is associated with less weight gain and potential beneficial effects on muscle mass over time.

title: Think twice before starting this
paragraph: This company gives you prescription medication for HRT without doing any sort of lab work. You must have lab work done in order to see where your hormone imbalance is so that they can prescribe the right HRT for your deficiency. When I clicked the get started button, I knew they would ask for lab work, but they did not. A doctor just prescribed and sent out to me. I thought that was odd. After further research it is not in my best interest to start something where I may not have an imbalance and could cause more harm than good. I tried to return an unopened package, but they will not accept it and give me a refund. Think twice before starting this. I‚Äôm very disappointed.
reply_paragraph: We understand that many people think that blood work is a better guide to prescribing HRT, but blood hormone levels can vary greatly from day-to-day, so blood tests are not necessarily an accurate indication of what you might need. Bloodwork can appear "perfect" on paper, but you still may have symptoms.HRT is, therefore, prescribed based on symptoms and medical history. We want you to feel better, not necessarily "fix" your lab values. The information provided in the onboarding process is used to determine what medications and what dosage would work best for you. Our Winona doctors are very successful in safely prescribing HRT for thousands of women through this process. We understand your concern about returning the medications, but they are prescriptions that are formulated for each patient and cannot be used again for another patient. We encourage you to reach out to your Winona doctor to discuss and they can fully explain how this process works and why they prescribed the medications that they did. We truly want you to feel better! If we can help in any way, please let us know.

title: Safe & Effective for Most Symptoms
paragraph: The eatrogen-progestin cream is very effective for sleep disruption, hot flashes, the hot-cold slimy sweats, helps w/brain fog, concentration, overall mood, and to a lesser extent, vaginal dryness. Don't waste your hard-earned time & money visiting your local doctor b/c not only do they not care about women's issues, but their lack of knowledge regarding female anatomy & our basic biological functions regarding hormonal fluctuations is alarming.Within approximately one week, the symptoms that have been negatively affecting your day to day life & relationships, will dissipate. Additionally, Winona's telehealth process & delivery methods are timely & efficient. Their Q & A doctor portal is fantastic whenever you have an inquiry or concern. Dr. Green typically responds within 24 hours or less. The reason I cannot give ByWinona 5 stars is due to the lack of efficacy of DHEA with regard to increasing sexual desire. Though it is thought to help convert to testosterone, and therefore, increase sex drive, after about 6 months, I have not experienced these results even though my prescription was increased from 25 mgs per day of DHEA to 50 mgs nearly 3 months ago. Therefore, if you are struggling with arousal issues, something stronger is needed. Studies have shown a lack of efficacy for DHEA, especially at such low levels. Though it is a banned substance in athletics, typically, athletes who use it to enhance performance, are taking upwarda of 200 to 400 mgs per day, which could result in adverse effects.My advice to Dr. Green would be to connect clients to local doctors who will prescribe testosterone to replace what we normally lose as we age; especially during menopause. On average, pre-menopausal women have one tenth the amount of testosterone in men. Combined with estrogen & progesterone, the testosterone we naturally have when we're very young, jump-starts female arousal, desire, fantasies, pleasure & of course,orgasm.The other alternative would be for  the doctor AND patient to file with the DEA to receive permission to send the controlled substance (in this case, testosterone) through mail-order. However, I understand the complexities of such a system.Regardless, if you're suffering from the plethora of menopausal symptoms I've described above, ByWinona, will most definitely alleviate those issues, and you can get your life back. Hopefully, Dr. Green will find a more effective alternative to DHEA. This issue is just as important & life-changing for women as it is for men. In fact, it's even more crucial for women, since sexual dysfunction is often overlooked and ignored by the mainstream medical field.

paragraph: I'm not going to lie, menopause was a rough time for me. Hot flashes, night sweats, mood swings, you name it. I tried everything to get relief, but nothing seemed to work. Then, I heard about Winona. I started taking Winona a few months ago, and I'm so glad I did. The hot flashes and night sweats have lessened, my mood swings have stabilized, and I have more energy. I let Dr. Green know about the sweats and he adjusted my Rx. I look forward to seeing those results too! I feel like my old self again! I would definitely recommend Winona to any woman who is struggling with menopause. It's effective in relieving the symptoms of menopause and it's affordable. If you're looking for a way to relieve the symptoms of menopause, I highly recommend Winona. It's been a lifesaver for me! I used to be so moody, I would snap at everyone for no reason. But now, I'm much more patient and understanding. If you're struggling with the symptoms of menopause, I encourage you to try Winona. It may just change your life!

title: It has given me my life and sanity back!!!
paragraph: My experience so far has been wonderful although it has taken some time, patience and a combination of other solutions that I have researched on my own. The Winona RX of Estrogen/Progesterone cream and DHEA have resulted most of my symptoms subsiding completely!  I am extremely pleased and wish I had tried this sooner! Everyone's needs are different though, and for myself particularly, only the use of evening primrose oil three times a has helped to keep my hot flashes and night sweats at bay.  If I miss one dose of three per day, the hot flashes come right back within a couple hours.  So for me the Winona is not helping with those particular symptoms.  It has however given me my brain back (which also allowed me to keep my business open), I sleep great now, weight is stable and easier to lose, hair growing back, mood is great and no anxiety, and no aches and pains.  It has not helped me personally with low libido or atrophy.  I found another solution for the atrophy, a low dose estriol cream called Silky Peach by Parlor Games. That has helped immensely!!!  Nithing is helping me with my libido issues yet, but they may just be mental after dealing with so much pain for over a year. I have very little pain now so long as I stay consistent with applications of Silky Peach.   Anyway, definitely give Winona a try but be patient, especially if you've allowed your hormones to get off balance for a long period of time.  It takes months to balance out and everyone is different.  Winona has seriously contributed to giving me my life and sanity back!

paragraph: I had been fretting over the possibility that I may never be able to have, let alone enjoy intimacy again due to prohibitive vaginal & perineal pain that felt like chards of glass as well as constriction since 2020. I‚Äôd entered perimenopause in late 2016 and transitioned into menopause by 2018 with relentless hot flashes and drenching 10 minute sweat sessions 3 to 4 times per hour. The hot flashes subsided by 2022 but the pain did not. I began my treatment with Winona in April of 2023 and by the 3 to 4 week mark I was back 100% and better than I‚Äôve ever been in this department! paragraph: I am currently 47 and started menopause early at the age of 39. In the last 3 years I have struggled with constant and severe hot flashes to the point it would take my breath away, night sweats that would have me changing pjs sometimes twice, weird body odor I had never had before, vaginal dryness, loss of libido, and pretty major mood swings. I started HRT 10 weeks ago and every one of these symptoms have improved dramatically! I‚Äôm sleeping better, I don‚Äôt feel like a crazy person in a constant fog, and seldom have a hot flash now, but best of all my husband and I have a renewed sex life! I am now off all other meds for depression and anxiety and finally feel like myself again! My only regret is not starting sooner! I know HRT isn‚Äôt for everyone, but it has been life changing for me! Talk to Dr Green and ask all the questions! He responds fairly quickly, is extremely knowledgeable, and will help you find what works best for you! And I love having it delivered right to my door!

paragraph: I tried a half a dose of the progesterone/estrogen cream (rubbed 1 pump into forearms), and within an hour, I was extremely ill. I messaged the Dr, and he denied that it could be the cream and advise me to try it again. I am unwilling to do so. I requested a refund of the $180 cream, which was denied. Leaving reviews to warn other potential customers of the very scary and miserable side effects and the rip off scam that is this company.
reply_paragraph: We are sorry to hear that you had this experience! This is a very unusual response to our prescription creams. I got an email saying I had to respond within 12 hours to avoid the prescription being shipped!!!! The only reason I caught this was because the card I used was my Apple Card and I get instant notifications.I emailed them and they said they‚Äôd take care of it, for now it appears that they have. No one should be subject to jumping through hoops to avoid continuing with a product that clearly required a doctors review before sending, according to their email anyway. Be aware and know that if it doesn‚Äôt work out for you that you will need to take extra steps to ensure you are not billed.
reply_paragraph: Thank you for letting us know about this issue! We are aware that the wording about the follow up would lead patients to think that they would not receive a future order if it was not completed. Thank you again for providing this insight so that we can make our process easier for everyone!

title: Very happy I took the leap of faith
paragraph: Completed the questionnaire and was in contact with a physician fairly quickly.  I asked a ton of questions and felt good about the responses after doing my own research.  Felt a little weird about not having blood work done until learning that b/c women‚Äôs fluctuating hormones throughout the month even on a given time of day, drawing blood doesn‚Äôt give you a good clinical picture of what‚Äôs going on.  But signs and symptoms can give you an idea what‚Äôs really going on that may not be ‚Äúcaught‚Äù on any given day or time of a blood draw.  The physician was very thorough.  I started the topical estrogen/progesterone and within 8 days I was sleeping better and no night sweats and within a couple more days my hot flashes resolved.  I started 02/02 and haven‚Äôt had any hot flashes in a few weeks now (as of 03/26). And the very best part:  my heart palpitations are almost completely resolved.  With my hormonal changes I started experiencing heart palpitations.  My cardiologist believed it could be related to hormones but did his due diligence with the work up, which was all normal.  Am keeping in touch with my cardio but looks like those were definitely related to menopause.  The company is very responsive and helpful.  I am very happy I went for it.

title: Winona is a blessing!
paragraph: I believe I started my menopause journey about the age of 42, I‚Äôm now 57. It was awful! I started off with more night sweats then anything, So going on no sleep, I could barely function. My mood was all over the place. I went to my PC and was put on hormone therapy then. Sometime later they said I need to get off them, never really said why. I didn‚Äôt have any kind of problems with them and no health issues. Didn‚Äôt take long and I was miserable! That‚Äôs when I realized it gets so much worse then just night sweats. Just the intensity of all of it was more then I could bare! Went to a different practice to get help. That‚Äôs when they were just pushing antidepressants with all there side affects on me. It was crazy to me that they thought antidepressants were better then the hormones were. Told me nothing else they could do for meüò†Finally found a practitioner that put me back on low does hormones again, thank goodness! As the years have gone by so many more things have become an issue. Mood, anxiety and very very low libido. I would bring it up at doctor visits but it was pretty much them telling me you just have to except it, you are getting older you knowü§Ø Not good enough! Women should not have to live like that no matter what age.So I was feeling like there was nothing I could do, nobody would help. I couldn‚Äôt afford the pellets with all the fees and labs that goes along with it. Then I was doing a web search, I think for low libido, and Winona popped up. Was so excited that finally there was someone to help! The process was so easy! Just gave COMPLETE health history and my symptoms, and my hormone therapy was on its way. I do feel your symptoms are much more important then some lab work to figure out what you need to be your best self. I have been on hormone therapy through Winona for a little over 3 months. Still dialing in on my prescription strength, but my next 3 month prescription is on its way, and hopefully we got things figured out. I‚Äôm also on the DHEA and all I can say is my hubby is a very happy man these last few weeks‚ò∫Ô∏èI would like to see Winona be able to start prescribing testosterone, I think that would be wonderful, and helpful to so many women. But till then I will continue the DHEA. I have been very impressed with all Winona has done for me. I will be with them as long as I can, hopefully that‚Äôs forever!Its all been so promising since I found Winona that I can grow old with loving life again! Thanks for all you Winona doctors and staff, your a Godsend!

I must add that ever since that conversation I also changed my doctor! Nevertheless, in my research I came across Winona. After reading, and seeing all of the positive reviews, I felt I should give it a try, what did I have to lose at this point? As soon as I started taking the topical cream and taking the DHEA pills, I noticed a difference in me within less than two weeks. My mood was more positive, I wasn‚Äôt so tired as I had been, the night sweats stopped, the weight gain stopped, and here I am sharing this wonderful experience with all of you. The only negative thing I have to say is that I wish I would‚Äôve found this sooner! It has been a fabulous journey, and I am so glad I got on the Winona bandwagon! I truly hope it works for you as it has for me, and all women that raved about these products. Lastly, I need to add that their customer service is absolutely hands-down, a five-star experience all in itself. They are always very helpful, willing to help with any issues or questions that I have had. Take it from me, don‚Äôt think twice, give this product a try  I know you will be happy with the results. Best of luck to all!

title: I love my experience with Winona!
paragraph: I love my experience with Winona ‚Äî it was so easy!  I had been trying for years during premenopause and perimenopause to balance my hormones.  I am a believer in vitamin supplements, eating well, and keeping sugar intake to a minimum.  I think that has helped for sure, but I needed more.  I read Dr. John Lee‚Äôs famous books and decided to use progesterone cream by itself for a while, and it worked at first.  When it stopped working to reduce symptoms, I tried an over the counter combined progesterone and phytoestrogen cream.  It seemed to make symptoms worse.  I then started on Amberen.  It helped me with many of my symptoms and for a short time helped with hot flashes.  Soon, the hot flashes and night sweats came rushing back.  I was so ready to get serious about starting BHRT.  I had wanted to for several years, but finding a doctor who specialized was going to be expensive.  Most wanted to do lots of sex hormone testing on a regular basis which can be quite costly.  Then I came across the Winona website.  I took a chance and I‚Äôm so glad I did.  The hot flashes and night sweats are gone.  I am sleeping much better, and most of the time all the way through the night without getting up once.  Also, intimacy with my husband is not painful (wink, wink).  If you are on the fence about BHRT, give it a try ‚Äî you‚Äôve got nothing to lose!

paragraph: I have been very happy with the medication my doctor has prescribed. I reached out to my Winona physician and she was able to tweak the prescription and now I'm feeling better than ever. Brain fog, insomnia, heart palpitations, hot flashes- all gone!! My only complaint is with the notifications set-up. I have to constantly remember to log into my account to check for any messages from my physician because the notifications never come through on my device. I used to get them as a push notification as well as an email but something changed and I no longer get notified when I have a message from the doctor, or even when my meds are sent out to me. I've reached out to winona support but they say everything is fine. I waited for over a week for my new prescription to arrive in the mail because I was not notified that the doctor had reached out to confirm the order until 4 days later and my current bottle had run out. I was back to being miserable for a few weeks before the current cream could help me get back on track with the hormones. I'd definitely recommend Winona to anyone looking for peri/menopause relief but just be warned you may have issues with communicating with your physician.

These products work. As soon as I started applying the cream, it was instant relief of the night sweats and I found I could sleep again through the night. In a few weeks, I started seeing my mood shift and just recently I feel the bloating and weight gain finally starting to subside.  I've been on the products for a little over 10 weeks and I am so happy I found them.  They are truly a lifesaver for me. I am feeling more and more like my old self and so many people notice the shift in my mood. I don't feel bloated or have the blahs anymore. I feel like me before menopause and I'm starting to see so much more energy.  If you're on the fence, I say give it a try.  I was very skeptical but went for it. I am so glad I did.

After customer service inquired as to how often I was using it, I realized my mistake and was using too much. The instructions were clear, but my foggy brain read them wrong when I first received the prescription! However, the Winona Team was so caring and responsive in getting my shipment out to me as quickly as possible that all of my fears and worries just went away. I started with skepticism as to the professionalism due to the cream running out earlier than expected. However, I ended up being a very happy customer after realizing it was my mistake and Winona took immediate action in helping me get squared away. paragraph: It‚Äôs easy to get started with Winona and pay for the cookie-cutter initial treatment.  But then it went off the rails for me and there isn‚Äôt a personalized plan for prescriptions. Try something different with a local provider.‚Äù  Very, very disappointing and a waste of time.  In the meantime, the company is very disjointed and there‚Äôs no communication within departments.  If someone reaches out to ask how it‚Äôs going, you can‚Äôt get help from that person.  They will direct you to someone else, who then directs you to someone else.  If your doctor says sorry, try something different, the company doesn‚Äôt know you‚Äôve been dropped like a hot potato and will continue to try to charge your credit card indefinitely.  If the standard one-size-fits-all treatment doesn‚Äôt work for you, it‚Äôs just a hot mess and a waste of valuable time.

I have lost some weight but I'm attributing that to the fact that I have now have the energy to go to the Y and swim 3-4 times a week.    I guess it all goes hand in hand though.It has only been 4 weeks and so many improvements already, I am so pleased that I decided to try this!

I don't appreciate that being the most highlighted hook in their online advertising. Very few from what I've read on the support group realize any drop in weight (some even gain), so please don't lead with that! I've had some success with the cream and DHEA (more even moods, reduced night sweats & hot flashes, slight libido increase) but since hormones fluctuate daily, sometimes hourly, there is just not a consistent way to address ALL the things ALL the time - especially the frustrating weight gain!

title: Did This Thing Online
paragraph: 10 weeks or so ago, I was at the end of my patience with my body. I felt like I was trapped in a stranger‚Äôs body. Conceptually, I wanted sex, but it was just too much effort  suddenly. I also had began to hate my body, the body that had weathered so much and given life to 3 children. The one I should have been proud of. I had doctors‚Äô say, ‚ÄúYep, menopause sucks,‚Äù and ‚Äúdeal with it.‚Äù There seemed to be no hope.So I took a risk. Did this thing online. Took a quiz. reply_paragraph: Hi Nicole :)We are sorry to hear that you have gained weight. Our chief medical officer discusses it more here: https://youtu.be/5bZ33tLsUcc.  Your Winona doctor is available to you in the patient portal 7 days a week! He or she would be happy to offer suggestions or adjust your dose so we can help you get rid of the extra weight. We are here for you so please do not hesitate to reach out so we can help.

title: Beware, perimenopausal users!
paragraph: One of the reasons so many doctors don't think HRT is a good idea for perimenopausal women is because we're still producing our own hormones. Adding extra hormones in, while they "may" help with certain issues, more than likely will cause others. I found Winona online and thought that bHRT might be a good option for me. My skin had fallen apart, my libido was gone, my energy (I thought) was in the tank and I was curious about my options. Night sweats and hot flashes were, thankfully, being controlled by a maca supplement.I ran through the way-too-brief "medical questionaire" and was assigned a doctor who very quickly prescribed me a combo estrogen/progesterone cream and DHEA. As luck would have it, I started the cream the day my period started so I was able to track my "progress" in line with my regular cycle. Things were great for the first ten days. My period was only a couple days long, unusual for me, and my mood was GREAT. My skin dramatically plumped up (seriously, wrinkles around my eyes were GONE). I felt great, looked great...was only concerned really about how "too" energetic I was. I thought it might be the DHEA. On the tenth day though, I plummeted into the worst depression I'd had since I was on birth control 12 years ago. I hated my husband. I was crying nonstop for two days. I couldn't sleep at night and when I was awake, I was anxious and my mind was racing. This is a really scary reaction. My gums became incredibly swollen and sore and I assumed what had happened was I ovulated around day 10 and was now experiencing progesterone overload. The first ten days I had all the Winona estrogen plus my own - and all the benefits of that - and then I had all the Winona progesterone plus my own - and that threw me into the symptoms and problems that got me off the pill a decade earlier. I contacted my doctor and gave him the run-down. I didn't hear back from him for nearly a full 24 hours (I get this isn't probably his full-time gig, but if that's the case, Winona needs a nurse or someone else to talk to when starting this product). His assessment was it sounded like I was getting too much progesterone. Unfortunately, he couldn‚Äôt write a new prescription for the same estrogen and less progesterone because the cream apparently only came in two formulations. What? I thought this was supposed to be ‚Äúcompounded specifically for me‚Äù? Wasn‚Äôt that a benefit of bHRT? That‚Äôs how Winona marketed itself. So my only option was essentially, to switch to pills (which I didn‚Äôt want, was trying to leave my liver out of this) or try the other formulation of cream. He essentially then asked, ‚ÄúWhat do you want to do?‚Äù I don‚Äôt know, I‚Äôm not the doctor here!I gave it a couple days to see how things panned out, then messaged him back that things were the same, if not worse. He then told me my symptoms could be caused by too much progesterone, or by too little. Good grief. He recommended increasing the estrogen to counter the progesterone. That was a red flag for me. Any reputable doctor IMO knows that with HRT you should always go for the least amount of hormones possible for symptom relief. I asked him if increasing the estrogen would cause any problems and he essentially said no, my body would "adjust" to it. At this point, I was feeling very uncomfortable and didn't want to "guess" at what was needed. I cancelled my prescription fourteen days in to the treatment, feeling like I'd been ripped off of $199. I stopped the cream cold turkey and had a very long, very heavy "withdrawal bleed" and some teenagerish breakouts. Now, a week later I'm starting to feel "normal" again, but back to my saggy skin. At least I don't hate my husband anymore!Of note, a couple days after cancelling my subscription I started getting marketing emails from Winona trying to get me to purchase the product (you guys should know I'm no longer a customer)...and to add insult to injury, one included a coupon code for 40% off!I can't speak to how this product affects post-menopausal women. I suppose it would be much more successful as it truly is "hormone replacement", whereas with me it was more "hormone supplementation" which is why it affected me like birth control pills did. This was a huge mistake on my part, using this product while my body is still making its own hormones. I'll figure out another way to deal with my symptoms.
reply_paragraph: Hi Stacy!Thank you very much for the detailed review. We take all feedback to heart and are currently evaluating internally to see how we can improve.I can say that we do offer significantly more than 2 options in the cream, we'll figure out why that may have been miscommunicated.Also, you should not have received those marketing emails so we're investigating that now. Thank you for helping us recognize this.Please know that you can always reach out to your Winona physician or our Patient Services team to discuss your feedback in more detail. Again, I am truly sorry for your poor experience, and I hope that your review is helpful for others. We do our absolute best to create the best experience for everyone.

title: Why did I wait???!!!!!
paragraph: To begin you will need to know history. I am 45 and still have a very regular and predictable period. I spent since I was about 38 convincing myself that no way in the world could I be having hormone issues with a period this regular and seemingly perfect! Well the symptoms slowly grew and grew. You just learn to live with them and it all seems so normal. Starting at around 38 I started getting what we call the meno-belly no matter how I ate or how much I worked out, which is very defeating when you are trying so hard. I was dealing with constant urination, never sleeping due to constant urination, racing thoughts and anxiety. I think I have lived off of about 3-4 hours tops a night of sleep for a long time now. Now here I am at 45 and my symptoms included lack of sleep, constant urination, even more meno-belly (to the point I went and got laser lipo, and it's trying to come back), fatigue, lack of motivation, dry eyes (I didn't even realize this was a symptom), vaginal dryness (this one is no fun), low libido (and I am actually very in love with my husband), severe bloating a good week before period would start and not subsiding til the end of my period, joint pain and stiffness (seems like I was being assigned a new pain/injury every single week), racing thoughts and unable to keep a straight thought, having trouble completing sentences or recalling things I should easily be able to recall, weird little headaches over the top of my left eye. It's hard keeping track of all these symptoms so I may be missing a couple. Skip to now. I am 5 weeks in to my BIO-HRT treatment. My Winona Doctor put me on DHEA and estrogen/progesterone cream. I take my DHEA around 5pm and my cream around 9pm. After 5 weeks I no longer have any of the symptoms listed above, except for the weight loss. That will take a few months to happen so I have to be patient. But I can tell you that I have had one period so far since on the treatment and this period was lighter, I did not get a headache and noticed very little bloating. The period also ended a day sooner than normal. I am sleeping like the dead. Last night I went to bed at 10:00 (my fault, I shouldn't have stayed up watching the movie) and I didn't budge until 5:45am, and that was only because our Pug woke me up. Not having to pee every single 10 minutes is life changing. Not even realizing how dry your eyes truly were until they aren't anymore is life changing. It's all life changing!!! I am kicking myself for not starting this at least 5 years ago. Why did I wait? I can't answer that question. Literally every single symptom I have listed above has improved. I can't believe my libido! My vaginal dryness is completely gone. I am enjoying intimacy again with my husband and this has made him happy again as well. It doesn't only effect me, it effects the people close to me. My mood is stable, I feel calm all the time. I could go on and on all day. I did have a little fatigue at the beginning, kind of like the fatigue I had in my first trimester of my only two pregnancies. It has subsided tremendously just like the doctor said it would. I have energy. As I sit here typing this I just realized I didn't hit my daily 2 o'clock brick wall that I normally hit. I noticed I don't seem to have much appetite. It only seems to be that way because I am not craving anything anymore. I don't know if that's a side effect of treatment or not but I sure will take it. I have already started recommending this to my girlfriends. If you are on the fence, please don't be. Do yourself a favor and don't be like me. Don't be in denial. It takes your body some adjustment but once that phase passes it's all smooth sailing and you will feel amazing. the Winona team is there for you if you have any questions or even feel your treatment should be adjusted. The Facebook support group page is awesome! A couple of my symptoms I found out were actually symptoms because of joining that page. Do it for yourself. Feel better. Don't be afraid. Give it a fair chance and you may very well find that you have changed your life and you can quit suffering needlessly. This day in age no woman should have to suffer. I hope to see you on the FB support page saying how much you love it and sharing your story. Good luck ladies!

paragraph: Winona has been such a positive experience for me. I was having atleast 5 hot flashes a day that were lasting 5 minutes or more. At night, I would wake up covered in sweat. I knew my body was changing and my moods were even being effected.  I started to research HRT and came across By Winona. I was skeptical due to not really knowing anything about HRT.  I talked to Dr Green and asked lots of questions, he was very quick to respond back in explaining how HRT works.  I started on the medication he prescribed, after about 4 weeks I started noticing changes in how I was feeling and even loosing a few pounds which I have not been able to do in 5 years. I felt like I was stuck on the same weight no matter what I did. My hot flashes definitely started to resolve. My sleeping patterns changed for the better. I am now at 10 weeks and feel like a new woman.  My boyfriend even noticed changes in my body.  My moods are so much better.  I can not say enough about By Winona.  Thank you Dr Green and all your staff. Stacey Rene‚Äô

title: 11 months of rollercoster hormones, Winona helps
paragraph: Until this year my periods were on time and moderate. I am 46. For the past 11 months since the day I reviewed my second dose of Phitzer my periods have been either 2x per month or 47-60 between. Horrible breast tenderness for weeks, heavy periods and massive cramps. All my blood tests came back normal. My energy has been off, my hair started falling out. As an acupuncturist and herbalist I decided that trying Winona to kick start my cycle. This is the 1st time in 11 months my period was on time, minimal cramping and normal flow. My energy now back and my hair stopped falling out. It‚Äôs started helping by week 2.  Hoping that the same happens this month. I am to young to have this level of peri menopause. I am happy I tried Winona and would definitely recommend it. It‚Äôs been a roller coaster with no answers for months. Winona may save my hormonal life!

title: Thank you, Winona
paragraph: For the first time in over a decade, my body feels the way it did before my total hysterectomy. Winona has brought back the romance in my marriage.

title: A Total Game Changer!
paragraph: After having a hysterectomy at 38, leaving me with one ovary, it was hard to tell whether I was in menopause or not. After working out and working harder, but the scale constantly budging northwards, my skin looking older and older despite an arsenal of products and drinking a lake‚Äôs worth of water a day, I had to face facts. I thought ‚Äúwell, why not try hormones‚Äù after my Doctor was less than helpful by telling me to try things from the cvs to help. Winona made a world of difference. Immediately.I hadn‚Äôt realized that the ‚Äúsleep‚Äù I was getting wasn‚Äôt restorative. Within the first few days, I was sleeping deeply and not waking up sweaty. My mental clarity improved. And so did my skin!After a month, my weight stabilized and my old lines started to appear where before I was looking puffy and chunky.I feel like my normal self again! Not the aging brittle version I felt like before I started!I‚Äôve referred at least two friends so far who are having the same results!!!

title: I am so happy with my decision to try‚Ä¶
paragraph: I am so happy with my decision to try winona. I have been on their products for 3 months now and couldn't be happier. I was experiencing brain fog, night sweats that kept me from getting a good night's sleep, lack of libido, bloating and weight gain. Since I have been taking Winona, I have noticed a change in my metal clarity, libido and just over all feeling more like myself again. I am still dealing with my weight and bloating but I‚Äôm sure the longer I am on it I will start noticing a difference in that as well. My medication was just adjusted slightly so I am keeping my fingers crossed! What I really liked about Winona is that if you have any questions or concerns you can message them and actually get a response in a reasonable time. Thank you Winona!

title: Good results so far
paragraph: I have been having the typical menopausal symptoms as most women....hot flashes, no libido, no energy, can't sleep and the worst one....weight gain. The meds my Dr put me on had only been adjusted once and no difference in a year. I started with Winona 2 weeks ago and I have already dropped a few pounds, I have more energy, I don't feel as warm and "flashy" as I was before, everything has improved! I honestly didn't think I would notice anything yet, but I have! I know everyone is different,  but its easy to use and they told me what meds I should continue and which ones I could stop. My only concern is how do I explain this to my( male)Ob-Gyn?üòÅ
